story:
Graphic Communication & Illustration Exhibition

Supernova 2014 is a collaborative degree show exhibition between BA Graphic Communication & Illustration at the University of Northampton. We are a group of 57 students now preparing our degree show for the public, which will run between 12th - 27th June. 

We are all working hard at producing an exciting and unique mix of work, which will consist of installation art, printed books, digital work, printmaking and more. 

Our overall goal for fundraising is £3000, and with your help this can be achieved. Donations will go towards creating a degree show catalogue which will showcase all of our best work, this is imperative as potential employers can take a copy and refer back to it when offering employment opportunities and it also acts a memento of our last three years at the university. It will also go towards the promotional elements for the show, website hosting and funds to help build the show. 

By donating towards the show you will be investing in the future of all of our careers. We will be posting updates on our Facebook page, twitter and instagram on the lead up to the show with previews of our work.

All donations are greatly appreciated and make a difference.

You can follow the progression of our degree show through our Facebook and twitter pages:

https://www.facebook.com/Supernovashow2014

https://twitter.com/SNShow2014

For any enquiries, please email: supernovashow@outlook.com

Thank you for the support, 

We look forward to seeing you in June.

story:
A revolutionary charger that saves energy and the environment, as well as protects your batteries lifespan. Quality charging with one touch.

 

SWITCH ON

SWITCH OFF

 

 

 

   

 

Support us now in order to get the best possible price, exclusive updates from the team and receive your BrightCharger before anyone else.  Early birds available!

BrightCharger is the perfect high-value gift for your employees. By acquiring BrightChargers for your employees you are actively protecting their phone and tablet batteries. This will give the devices a longer lifespan so you don't have to buy new phones every couple of years. You can find options for 10 and 50 BrightChargers from our perks, but if you are interested in acquiring in any other amount, feel free to contact us to discuss.

BrightCharger is a 5V 1A charger.

Innovation and expertise are in our DNA.

BrightCharger’s international 13 member team connects sales with global manufacturing, product and business development, and IPR expertise with national, European and International networks. The team aims to push the boundaries of implementation of BrightCharger products for an International market.

For more info, please visit the BrightCharger website.

We chose to launch BrightCharger on Indiegogo because we wanted to share our invention with a community of like-minded people who not only appreciate quality products but who are also mindful of protecting the environment. We wanted to create something that was both beautifully designed and practical as well as affordable - quality products don’t need to cost a fortune! Support us today and help us launch BrightCharger so we can continue to develop new innovations for the eco-conscious consumer. 

We will deliver the devices starting from October 2017 and depending in which country you are located, you will receive your BrightCharger in October / November 2017. Well in time for Christmas in case you are looking for the perfect gift for a friend or a family member who appreciates something that is eco-friendly, enhances battery safety and of course looks good.

We believe in our product, but sometimes the unexpected happens and we want to make sure you feel secure with a purchase. We are offering all of our backers a one year warranty for their BrightChargers in case something happens to the device and it breaks.   

BrightCharger is now in the prototype stage and the final product will be ready in August 2017. We already have a delivery system in place and as soon as the campaign is fully funded and completed we will start the final stage of the production. We are currently in the process of getting the product certification and have about 300 working units ready that we are conducting tests on and so far the results have been excellent. Even though we have a precise and well thought out plan in place, there is always a risk of something unexpected happening in the final production process. If any delays were to occur we will contact Backers immediately.  

When is BrightCharger expected to ship?
Our estimated shipping date is October 2017.

Does BrightCharger ship to my country?
Yes, we ship anywhere in the world. That being said, we only offer options for a US and EU plugs so make sure you order the correct plug according to your country specification. BrightCharger's operating range is 90-260V. 

What if something happens to my BrightCharger and it breaks?
We are offering our backers a one year warranty on their BrightChargers. 

What does a fixed goal mean?
If the minimum funding goal of $10,000 isn’t met, all backers will be reimbursed. This means we only get to keep the amount of money raised if we reach 100% of our funding goal, so there is no risk for you. 

Why should I buy BrightCharger over any other charger?
Regular chargers consume unnecessary energy by forcing idle power to a connected battery even after the battery is already full. BrightCharger uses only a part of the energy, therefore protecting your battery life, devices, and the environment. BrightCharger also functions as a low energy consumption nightlight which adds, even more, value to the product.  

Doesn't a charger like this already exist?
No, it does not. The idea behind BrightCharger is to avoid unnecessary electricity consumption. The charger switches itself off as soon as the battery is fully charged. Only the very low consumption LED signal light (nightlight) will indicate to users when the device is fully charged. The users can choose whether they want to enable and disable the signal light feature.

My battery was not fully charged (100%) when the BrightCharger stopped charging it. What happened?
Our goal is to ensure a charge level above 90% for all USB-chargeable devices at the end of the charging process. Based on the latest studies, this particular charge level is the most beneficial to all USB-chargeable batteries and prolongs their lifespan. 

When I plug my phone in before going to bed in the evening, the battery is not fully charged in the morning as the BrightCharger does not allow the charger to maintain the charge level. Why does it do that?
This is true when using the BrightCharger. However, as smartphone users may have noticed (and can easily test), charge levels may decrease by up to 5% within minutes of unplugging a when unplugging a fully-charged phone from a charger. In reality, the ideal charge level range for the Lithium-ion batteries of smartphones lies between 10% and 90%. The charge level decreases more rapidly when higher than 90% or lower than 10%. The battery producers provide estimations of how long the battery can be charged. Why worry about such time limits or harm the battery by overcharging it? Thanks to the BrightCharger feature, the lifespan of all batteries is longer.

How much energy can be saved using the BrightCharger?
There are only rough estimations of the amount of energy wasted globally in maintaining battery charge levels or by leaving chargers plugged in. We think that saving even a single watt of electricity is good for both the wallet and the environment.

How does BrightCharger differ from other chargers that include automated charging technology? How about smartphones that have inbuilt features that stop charging on their own?
Many mobile devices contain different battery control systems and automated charging technologies. The automated charging technologies of modern smartphones work well. As soon as the battery is fully charged, maintenance charging ends as the charger switches into standby mode and stops charging the device. The charger itself still continues to consume energy. This energy consumption of high-quality chargers is very low, even close to zero. The problem arises when the charge level of the device decreases by even 1%. This activates the charger and begins charging the device. Depending on the condition and age of the battery, this may take for example 15 minutes, after which the charger’s standby mode is reactivated. As a result of this cycle, the device is charged almost continuously. Another group of chargers consumes small amounts of energy (e.g. 1.5 W). After connecting the phone to the charger and achieving a full charge level, this basic consumption increases slightly (e.g. to 1.8 W) to maintain the charge level – essentially charging the phone continuously. The third group of chargers and devices have no automated charging technologies.

I could imagine purchasing a BrightCharger if it did not waste electricity on the LED signal light.
It is true that Brightcharger continues to consume energy because of the signal light (the nightlight mode). These consumption levels, thanks to modern LED-technology, are very close to zero. Additionally, the nightlight mode can be disabled, and the charger switches itself off completely as soon as the battery is fully charged.

For any other question, please contact:  hello@brightcharger.com

story:
Why launching AnyTouch Blue through the Indiegogo platform?

   We would like to reach every person that still doesn’t know about AnyTouch Blue the world’s first smart wireless presenter through Indiegogo since it offers a large platform of tech enthusiasts looking for the best technological solutions. Our startup has already invested most of its resources in the development and mass production of AnyTouch Blue. With the limited remaining resources it is time to go global. The reach and popularity of Indiegogo as a global crowdfunding site will provide us with the required global exposure that we need to successfully launch our product.

 

Why we need your help?

We have already produced 10,000 AnyTouch Blue units, if we are not able to sell them it will become a financial burden for our startup. We need your help in order to continue developing and providing innovative technological solutions

story:
About Ares

1. What is Ares

After nearly a year of research and development, EasyArts (making arts easy for you) is now releasing its first launch of All-in-one 3D printer -- Ares, in the name of the Greek god of war. It is a luxury version at civilian price. We hope that this affordable printer can meet most of your daily requirements in terms of creation and innovation. Ares is especially suitable for fans, enterprise, homes, educational institutions or any other interested in 3D printer.

2. Ares gains reputation

3. What pushes us to develop Ares

Right now, there are so many 3D printers on the market that it is really hard for users to make a decision. So the main problem is which one is more suitable, for instance, most cost-effective or easiest to use? We (EasyArts team) were ever faced with the same dilemma. That is why we decided to develop a new printer integrated with multi-functional modules, as well as stable structure, friendly interface, easy operation and affordable price. We believe that 3D printers should be common items just like household laser printers, rather than high-tech products far from folks.


Why so inexpensive

You may wonder why such a good product is at such a low price. It might even seem incredible to you, as overall the 3D printers on market is a bit expensive. You may once wish you could have a low-cost 3D printer, and so did us. But now we dare say that it has become reality. Ares is just for you, really cost-effective and highly extendable. However, low-cost doesn’t necessarily mean poor quality. Actually, if interested in Ares, you should read our story slowly and carefully, then you will think Ares is of high quality. Honestly, we have to admit that we couldn’t make it without several advantages.

1. Open-source

Our design is based on open-source, both in terms of software and firmware. It is our full use of the creativity from all over the world that saves the time and cost during the development.

2. Made in China

You probably have known something about “Made in China”, as the product manufacturing is highly developed in China. “Made in China” makes the most contribution to manufacturing good products by skilled workers yet with much lower labor costs.

3. To gain visibility

In fact, the price is almost at the cost of our products. Our aim of this campaign is to raise the awareness of public that most of you can afford 3D printers. It is no longer a high-tech product. As a start-up company for 3D printing, quality is the key to survival. So we worry more about the quality of Ares than you.


Why should choose Ares

1. Full-metal Body: Say no to deformation

Metal body is a major feature of Ares, along with black exterior, making it low profile and steady, but also luxurious. Moreover, more than 90% of the load-bearing parts are made by metal and processed by CNC. In addition, the driving belt is made of polyurethane and steel wire to avoid deformation. It is worth mentioning that the full-metal body contributes to minimize the gap between the parts, and thus to prevent any possible distortion during printing. Therefore, the printed parts present extremely smooth surfaces, surpassing the apparent staircase effect in other hot-melt printers.


2. Modular Design: Unlimited extension of your imagination

Modular design enables users greater space for extension. As the core of this printer, the switchable platform plays a vital role. It allows users to take advantage of the reserved holes on it to adapt various nozzles, like laser transmitters, CNC cutters and so on. Besides, the aviation aluminum alloy connector, processed by surface adonization and CNC, is the privilege accessory for Ares to meet multi-functional connections. Most of all, you can design your own connectors to adapt your extended tools. The function of your 3D printer can be instantly upgraded and converted, as long as the adapter or connector matches the reserved holes. In addition, with up to 15 ports, the aerial socket for wiring provides possibilities for unlimited upgrade.


3. Commercially Open-source: Be support technician yourself

We know that many people worry about the technical support and warranty. Indeed, it will spend too much time and money for you and us if something wrong happens to Ares after delivery. So we will always get Ares completely checked before shipping. We have tested our prototypes everyday for over 4 months, it still works very well. We can guarantee that the overall structure is stiff and durable, like the motors, gears, linear guide-way, joint, PCB boards, driving belt and so on.

However, like most products, there exists vulnerable parts like print nozzle. For both of your and our convenience, we will publish the details of currently commercially available parts in our user manual. In this way, you can renew most of the broken parts yourself. Of course you can email us your problem and we will surely give you technical support. We hope this (commercially open-source) can help you and us address most of your problem during daily creation.


What makes Ares outstanding

1. 3D printing: Colorful, complex and even tiny

Similar to many other 3D printers, PLA filaments is the main consume materials in terms of 3D printing function, as it is both friendly to human and environment. So of course you can make colorful and complex 3D samples and even products. Particularly, the minimized gap between the moving parts significantly prevents apparent staircase effect on the surface of printed models. Surprisingly, Ares can print tiny model even smaller than finger. (Models are from Thingiverse)

  


2. Laser engraving: Essential tool for DIY makers

As laser engraving is very popular to DIY makers, Ares series are also equipped with laser engraving kits. In consideration of practicality and safety, we think 300mW power will be enough for daily DIY. For instance, you can engrave your logo or picture on a card, leather, or wood, and even cut the paper into your design. Worried about the precision? Just scan the 2D code below and see what happens on Wechat or Facebook.

 


3. CNC engraving (under development): 3D pictures

In view of practicality and safety, the CNC engraving kit for Ares consists of a motor (maximum speed - 4000 rpm/min) and milling cutters of various sizes for corn. So now 3D pictures are available for you by engraving patterns on the cork and wood. Besides, you can design arbitrarily complex 3D models to form your exclusive wooden carvings in relief.


4. 3D Scanning: Much more creation and extension

3D scanning, or 3D reversion, just makes your creation and extension simpler and easier. With laser line scanners, and high-definition cameras, Ares can deal with most of daily objects very well in high resolution. The design of quick setup makes 3D scanner portable and efficient for installation. In addition, you have many options to output the results, making it more convenient for modification and much more practical in DIY.


5. WiFi Access: So close to Ares

The Raspberry-Pi, an open source hardware built in Ares, is the central processing unit, much like the brain that controls Ares. Thanks to the support of WiFi, Raspberry-Pi makes it possible to achieve remote control and monitoring of your printer just by following our simple instruction and configuration, much easier than ever before. Surprisingly, you even may need't purchase a monitor for this function, just unplug the webcam from your computer instead, if available. It is especially convenient for office workers like you and me, isn't it?


6.More functions can be added: Unlimited

The functions of Ares 3D printer are not limited to what mentioned above. All of our designs and developments are based on open source firmware and software. As we all know, good quality is the precondition of extension. So we are trying our best to make sure Ares is competent for extension, like metal body, linear guide, aluminum CNC parts and so on. Not only that, you are greatly encouraged to develop your own modules by following our instructions. The standard of your connector or adapter has been defined in the user manual, so that your own design can match the switchable platform. As long as following this rule, chocolate printing, circuit board, any feasible extension is possible.


 Ares specification

1. Ares printer parameters


2. 3D scanning parameters

3. Laser engraving parameters

4. CNC engraving parameters


 Stretch goal

In order to thank your support of our product, all of you will receive our gifts on delivery, as long as the funding amount reaches the stretch goal. So let more people know us will also give yourself a great deal of benefits. Go ahead for the top!


Your gifts at stretched amount

    


 Timeline


 EasyArts team

During his PhD research at SC3DP (Singapore Center of 3D Printing, the biggest 3D printing laboratory in Asia), Shuai Li thought that 3D printers should not be the exclusives for laboratory, but also should be common products at low price to bring convenience for the folks with powerful functions. Soon after, he managed to establish a team aimed for this idea, called EasyArts, and now is the president of it. In EasyArts, the other members have the same idea and all agree with his leadership.

This is a professional team, consisting of three PhD researchers majored in 3D printing and lots of experienced engineers, skilled in either electrical & electronic, machanical, product engineering, computing technology , or marketing management. It is also a team of high efficiency, owing to the support of the business incubator of Wuhan ITRI (Industrial Technology Research Institute) of Geo-Resources and Environment Co., Ltd.

Finally, with the joint efforts of all team members and the leadership of Shuai and Xin, we finished the development of such an awesome product, that is, Ares All-in-one 3D Printer. In addition with complete supply chain and excellent capacity for mass production, we are able to ensure Ares can be put on your desk on time.


Core team members


Brief introduction

Shuai Li is the president and a developer in EasyArts. His execution, researching ability and spirit is overwhelming. Most of his inspiration on Ares profits from his research work at SC3DP, and his PhD experience gives him great courage and perseverance to overcome the difficulties during the development of Ares. We can completely immodestly say that he is an expert on 3D printing.

Xin Li is a competent manager due to his master's degree in business (MBA). On account of strong career passion and sharp market insights, he is actually the adviser on what functions of Ares are needed and how much is affordable to most people. So it is his considerable experience in marketing that provides guidance for the development of Ares.

Pengju Xue, majored in Mechanical Engineering related to 3D printing, is especially experienced in machinery design. He is the director of the mechanical structure design of Ares, as he can always come up with clever institutions to integrate all kinds of spare parts. So most of what you can see on Ares comes from his idea and inspiration. We are lucky to have such developer.

Guiru Zhu is a seasoned engineer. He is worthy of it because he once worked as a mechanical engineer for over 10 years. When he heard of EasyArts, he decided to leave his current job of high salary, since he also agrees that 3D printing is promising and why not be the common product just like household laser printer. Specifically, he made the most contributions to optimize the mechanical design.

Zhichao Chen was Shuai's classmate  during the period of both undergraduate and postgraduate. No wander he is another core member of EasyArts and the most ardent supporter. The same major and similar interests makes them maintain a high level of understanding in the development of Ares. Currently, he is responsible for the software development because of his programming skills.

Weidong Li, similar to Guiru, also quit his high-paying job in Beijing to join EasyArts. And now he takes charge of electrical & electronic module. He is regarded as a man with strong mastermind power. Just imagine how difficult and complex it is to integrate of so many functions into such limited space and circuit. Finally he made it, because of his hard-working and his professional competence as well.

Yuqian Zhang really stood out  other schoolgirls when she was an undergraduate. You know what? She spent her spare time in the library to learn product engineering and technology, which is nothing to do with her major. After several years of work as product engineer at Singapore, she achieved considerable experience on product engineering.

Hongyu Tian is particularly good at algorithm and optimization. We would say that he is a high-quality comprehensive talent, as he made lots of efforts and contributions to the mechanical design, software development and product engineering. It is hard to say when Ares could be available for release without his optimization. He is the one who first thought of applying Raspberry-Pi to Ares.


 Acknowledgement

Firstly we would like to thank the firmware made by Marlin, as well as many other open source projects by Octopi, Cura and Freelss and the persons who share their design on Thingvierse. It is the spirit of open source that pushes 3D printing forward a great deal, and that brings more people into the world of 3D. Consistent with such spirit, our design documents and relative software will be open source on delivery.

Then the special thanks will be given to the business incubator of Wuhan ITRI of Geo-Resources and Environment Co., Ltd.

And we really thank the creators for their fantastic 3D models:

MBCook Squirrel with Lego hand grip by cfg, Bear by ashih1, ZYYX vase by ZYYX3DPrinter, Sappho's Head by LukeChilson, Kickboxing by Complimesh, Parametric Lego Fence Door by projunk, Swedish Farm House by Cleven, are all licensed under the Creative Commons - Attribution - Share Alike license.
Pen Holder by damm301, Anais by fantasygraph, are licensed under the Creative Commons - Attribution license.


 Risks and challenges

1. Supply chain and logistics

No one wants to see a good idea being executed poorly. We have worked extremely hard to prepare mass production for Ares, but we still face several challenges. Currently, many suppliers have been secured for the components. The remaining issue is to set up warehouses for the production line. That's why we are constantly working with specialists of supply chain to establish a production line of high efficiency and reliability. The challenge is obvious as we must make sure the delivery of this amazing can be arranged as soon as possible. Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

2. Shipping

Shipping costs vary with your country and specific location. To reduce the cost of Ares at the maximum, we decide to charge the shipping costs separately, also for the sake of fairness. After the campaign, we will send you a survey by email to collect your basic contact details like name, address for delivery. Of course you can decide your own option for shipping. However, shipping is another risk which might be out of our control during delivery. So it is recommended that we choose the best shipping option for you, based on your location. According to your option, we will charge extra with the exact costs for shipping. We will arrange the shipment only after your payment has been confirmed. If you want to know how much it will cost, please contact us at easyarts@126.com.


 Frequently asked questions

Please read the FAQs below carefully before claim. If you cannot find what you are satisfied with or interested in, don't hesitate to contact us at easyarts@126.com.

Q1: Why it shows free shipping when I claim the perk, while actually shipping not included?

EasyArts: Okay, good question. We do apologize for this conflict. As you know, shipping fee for worldwide is various, so we cannot determine how much the shipping will cost. Indiegogo does NOT support various settings for shipping, so the default fee has to be $0, thus resulting in "free shipping". Shipping is NOT included for "Assembled ARES 3D Printer". Please refer to the "Risks and challenges" section for more details about shipping.

Q2:Why the price of three optional modules is different from each other?

EasyArts: Really good point. Many people may be wondering what is the price difference of our three optional modules, which is the same during previous campaign. Actually, if you read the description of these perks, you may realize some difference, that is, "Shipping HAS BEEN included". So that is the source of price difference. In other words, CNC costs most while Laser costs least in terms of shipping. We believe this will bring you and us greater convenience, as both of us can just care about the shipping fee of ARES. To put it another way, you won't worry how much it will cost for optional modules, which has been included.

Q3: How can you know which module(s) I have claimed without any comments?

EasyArts: Good question. Of course you can inform us at easyarts@126.com about your desired module(s) if you like. Actually, after this campaign, we will contact all of the supporters (contribute $399 or more) to confirm your module(s), no matter you have informed us or not. So don't worry about your module(s). If we still haven't got your confirmation before shipment, you will receive sequential module(s) (LASER ENGRAVING -> 3D SCANNING -> CNC ENGRAVING), so that you won't get same module(s) for a perk.

Q4: What if there is no available WiFi access? Can this printer work off-line?

EasyArts: WiFi or Internet access is our featured function for Ares in view of convenience, but NOT required. So you can still use the printer as long as you have a computer. Just connect your PC and 3D printer by the data cable we provide (2 meters long), your Ares will be able to work.

Q5: Do I have to install a specific software or app to control the printer?

EasyArts: No, the control system of Ares has already been installed inside the printer. And we offer a much more convenient option for Ares, that is, telnetting into the printer through browser. Please refer to the user's manual for the specific operation. In this way, you can gain control of Ares provided that you have a browser, no matter what kind of OS you use, for instance, Windows, Mac Os, Linux and Android.

Q6: Do I have to prepare specific formatted files for laser engraving or CNC milling function?

EasyArts: No special files are required for the laser engraving or CNC milling function. A self-developed software can help you deal with JPG/BMP files. We are glad to inform you that the software will be FREE if you claim ANY ONE of the perk except "Friendly Sponsorship".

Q7: Is it necessary to calibrate the platform before printing?

EasyArts: Normally NOT. Calibration of the platform is required ONLY when the location of your printer has been changed. In addition, the printer supports automatic calibration, which has been built inside, so don't worry about this if you have to calibrate the platform.

Q8: What is the resolution of the scanner? What if I want to scan/reverse colorful objects?

EasyArts: The available resolution is greater than or equal to 0.3 mm. The HD scanner and camera supports colorful mode, so your scanned models will also in similar color. Please refer to the specification section for more parameters of 3D scanning. Thank you.

Q9: What is the consume material for printing? Do I have to buy it from EasyArts?

EasyArts: Currently the main material for 3D printing function is PLA. It is expected that other various materials will be supported through extensions as well in the near future, for example, high-melting-point plastic (carbon fiber, nylon, graphene etc.). PLA is quite common now, we do offer perks for our contributors, but it is not a must to buy it from us. In fact, we will offer some free PLA (1kg) to improve your experience of Ares.

Q10: I am a DIY maker, can I develop my own module(s)?

EasyArts: Of course. Actually, this printer is for designers and DIY makers. The switchable platform is designed for such extensions. So we really encourage you to do this. Just follow the instructions and the standard for your adapter(s) / connector(s), which will be released after this campaign, you will find it quite easy to develop your own module(s). Go ahead for your imagination and creation.

Q11: I am a journalist, can I report the story about your team and your 3D printer?

EasyArts: You are mostly welcomed. Thank you for your willingness to help us popularize EasyArts and Ares. Don't hesitate to contact us at easyarts@126.com.

Q12: Do you need any distributors for this 3D printer? Is there any requirement to be your distributors?

EasyArts: Yes, any distributors interested in our product are warmly welcomed all around the world. We prefer to work together with you to generalize 3D printing technology. As for the requirements, we would like to say totally NO right now, so long as you want to join us. In addition, as our distributors, you will get professional training for the promotion of this printer for FREE. If you have such intention. please contact us at easyarts@126.com.
story_txt:
About Ares

1. What is Ares
After nearly a year of research and development, EasyArts (making arts easy for you) is now releasing its first launch of All-in-one 3D printer -- Ares, in the name of the Greek god of war. It is a luxury version at civilian price. We hope that this affordable printer can meet most of your daily requirements in terms of creation and innovation. Ares is especially suitable for fans, enterprise, homes, educational institutions or any other interested in 3D printer.
2. Ares gains reputation

3. What pushes us to develop Ares
Right now, there are so many 3D printers on the market that it is really hard for users to make a decision. So the main problem is which one is more suitable, for instance, most cost-effective or easiest to use? We (EasyArts team) were ever faced with the same dilemma. That is why we decided to develop a new printer integrated with multi-functional modules, as well as stable structure, friendly interface, easy operation and affordable price. We believe that 3D printers should be common items just like household laser printers, rather than high-tech products far from folks.


 Why so inexpensive

You may wonder why such a good product is at such a low price. It might even seem incredible to you, as overall the 3D printers on market is a bit expensive. You may once wish you could have a low-cost 3D printer, and so did us. But now we dare say that it has become reality. Ares is just for you, really cost-effective and highly extendable. However, low-cost doesn’t necessarily mean poor quality. Actually, if interested in Ares, you should read our story slowly and carefully, then you will think Ares is of high quality. Honestly, we have to admit that we couldn’t make it without several advantages.
1. Open-source
Our design is based on open-source, both in terms of software and firmware. It is our full use of the creativity from all over the world that saves the time and cost during the development.
2. Made in China
You probably have known something about “Made in China”, as the product manufacturing is highly developed in China. “Made in China” makes the most contribution to manufacturing good products by skilled workers yet with much lower labor costs.
3. To gain visibility
In fact, the price is almost at the cost of our products. Our aim of this campaign is to raise the awareness of public that most of you can afford 3D printers. It is no longer a high-tech product. As a start-up company for 3D printing, quality is the key to survival. So we worry more about the quality of Ares than you.


 Why should choose Ares

1. Full-metal Body: Say no to deformation
Metal body is a major feature of Ares, along with black exterior, making it low profile and steady, but also luxurious. Moreover, more than 90% of the load-bearing parts are made by metal and processed by CNC. In addition, the driving belt is made of polyurethane and steel wire to avoid deformation. It is worth mentioning that the full-metal body contributes to minimize the gap between the parts, and thus to prevent any possible distortion during printing. Therefore, the printed parts present extremely smooth
surfaces, surpassing the apparent staircase effect in other hot-melt printers.


2. Modular Design: Unlimited extension of your imagination
Modular design enables users greater space for extension. As the core of this printer, the switchable platform plays a vital role. It allows users to take advantage of the reserved holes on it to adapt various nozzles, like laser transmitters, CNC cutters and so on. Besides, the aviation aluminum alloy connector, processed by surface adonization and CNC, is the privilege accessory for Ares to meet multi-functional connections. Most of all, you can design your own connectors to adapt your extended tools. The function of your 3D printer can be instantly upgraded and converted, as long as the adapter or connector matches the reserved holes. In addition, with up to 15 ports, the aerial socket for wiring provides possibilities for unlimited upgrade.


3. Commercially Open-source: Be support technician yourself
We know that many people worry about the technical support and warranty. Indeed, it will spend too much time and money for you and us if something wrong happens to Ares after delivery. So we will always get Ares completely checked before shipping. We have tested our prototypes everyday for over 4 months, it still works very well. We can guarantee that the overall structure is stiff and durable, like the motors, gears, linear guide-way, joint, PCB boards, driving belt and so on.
However, like most products, there exists vulnerable parts like print nozzle. For both of your and our convenience, we will publish the details of currently commercially available parts in our user manual. In this way, you can renew most of the broken parts yourself. Of course you can email us your problem and we will surely give you technical support. We hope this (commercially open-source) can help you and us address most of your problem during daily creation.



 What makes Ares outstanding
1. 3D printing: Colorful, complex and even tiny
Similar to many other 3D printers, PLA filaments is the main consume materials in terms of 3D printing function, as it is both friendly to human and environment. So of course you can make colorful and complex 3D samples and even products. Particularly, the minimized gap between the moving parts significantly prevents apparent staircase effect on the surface of printed models. Surprisingly, Ares can print tiny model even smaller than finger. (Models are from Thingiverse)
  



2. Laser engraving: Essential tool for DIY makers
As laser engraving is very popular to DIY makers, Ares series are also equipped with laser engraving kits. In consideration of practicality and safety, we think 300mW power will be enough for daily DIY. For instance, you can engrave your logo or picture on a card, leather, or wood, and even cut the paper into your design. Worried about the precision? Just scan the 2D code below and see what happens on Wechat or Facebook.
 


3. CNC engraving (under development): 3D pictures
In view of practicality and safety, the CNC engraving kit for Ares consists of a motor (maximum speed - 4000 rpm/min) and milling cutters of various sizes for corn. So now 3D pictures are available for you by engraving patterns on the cork and wood. Besides, you can design arbitrarily complex 3D models to form your exclusive wooden carvings in relief.


4. 3D Scanning: Much more creation and extension
3D scanning, or 3D reversion, just makes your creation and extension simpler and easier. With laser line scanners, and high-definition cameras, Ares can deal with most of daily objects very well in high resolution. The design of quick setup makes 3D scanner portable and efficient for installation. In addition, you have many options to output the results, making it more convenient for modification and much more practical in DIY.






5. WiFi Access: So close to Ares

The Raspberry-Pi, an open source hardware built in Ares, is the central processing unit, much like the brain that controls Ares. Thanks to the support of WiFi, Raspberry-Pi makes it possible to achieve remote control and monitoring of your printer just by following our simple instruction and configuration, much easier than ever before. Surprisingly, you even may need't purchase a monitor for this function, just unplug the webcam from your computer instead, if available. It is especially convenient for office workers like you and me, isn't it?


6.More functions can be added: Unlimited
The functions of Ares 3D printer are not limited to what mentioned above. All of our designs and developments are based on open source firmware and software. As we all know, good quality is the precondition of extension. So we are trying our best to make sure Ares is competent for extension, like metal body, linear guide, aluminum CNC parts and so on. Not only that, you are greatly encouraged to develop your own modules by following our instructions. The standard of your connector or adapter has been defined in the user manual, so that your own design can match the switchable platform. As long as following this rule, chocolate printing, circuit board, any feasible extension is possible.



 Ares specification

1. Ares printer parameters




2. 3D scanning parameters

3. Laser engraving parameters


4. CNC engraving parameters




 Stretch goal

In order to thank your support of our product, all of you will receive our gifts on delivery, as long as the funding amount reaches the stretch goal. So let more people know us will also give yourself a great deal of benefits. Go ahead for the top!


Your gifts at stretched amount
    


 Timeline





 EasyArts team

During his PhD research at SC3DP (Singapore Center of 3D Printing, the biggest 3D printing laboratory in Asia), Shuai Li thought that 3D printers should not be the exclusives for laboratory, but also should be common products at low price to bring convenience for the folks with powerful functions. Soon after, he managed to establish a team aimed for this idea, called EasyArts, and now is the president of it. In EasyArts, the other members have the same idea and all agree with his leadership.
This is a professional team, consisting of three PhD researchers majored in 3D printing and lots of experienced engineers, skilled in either electrical & electronic, machanical, product engineering, computing technology , or marketing management. It is also a team of high efficiency, owing to the support of the business incubator of Wuhan ITRI (Industrial Technology Research Institute) of Geo-Resources and Environment Co., Ltd.
Finally, with the joint efforts of all team members and the leadership of Shuai and Xin, we finished the development of such an awesome product, that is, Ares All-in-one 3D Printer. In addition with complete supply chain and excellent capacity for mass production, we are able to ensure Ares can be put on your desk on time.

Core team members


Brief introduction
Shuai Li is the president and a developer in EasyArts. His execution, researching ability and spirit is overwhelming. Most of his inspiration on Ares profits from his research work at SC3DP, and his PhD experience gives him great courage and perseverance to overcome the difficulties during the development of Ares. We can completely immodestly say that he is an expert on 3D printing.
Xin Li is a competent manager due to his master's degree in business (MBA). On account of strong career passion and sharp market insights, he is actually the adviser on what functions of Ares are needed and how much is affordable to most people. So it is his considerable experience in marketing that provides guidance for the development of Ares.
Pengju Xue, majored in Mechanical Engineering related to 3D printing, is especially experienced in machinery design. He is the director of the mechanical structure design of Ares, as he can always come up with clever institutions to integrate all kinds of spare parts. So most of what you can see on Ares comes from his idea and inspiration. We are lucky to have such developer.
Guiru Zhu is a seasoned engineer. He is worthy of it because he once worked as a mechanical engineer for over 10 years. When he heard of EasyArts, he decided to leave his current job of high salary, since he also agrees that 3D printing is promising and why not be the common product just like household laser printer. Specifically, he made the most contributions to optimize the mechanical design.
Zhichao Chen was Shuai's classmate  during the period of both undergraduate and postgraduate. No wander he is another core member of EasyArts and the most ardent supporter. The same major and similar interests makes them maintain a high level of understanding in the development of Ares. Currently, he is responsible for the software development because of his programming skills.
Weidong Li, similar to Guiru, also quit his high-paying job in Beijing to join EasyArts. And now he takes charge of electrical & electronic module. He is regarded as a man with strong mastermind power. Just imagine how difficult and complex it is to integrate of so many functions into such limited space and circuit. Finally he made it, because of his hard-working and his professional competence as well.
Yuqian Zhang really stood out  other schoolgirls when she was an undergraduate. You know what? She spent her spare time in the library to learn product engineering and technology, which is nothing to do with her major. After several years of work as product engineer at Singapore, she achieved considerable experience on product engineering.
Hongyu Tian is particularly good at algorithm and optimization. We would say that he is a high-quality comprehensive talent, as he made lots of efforts and contributions to the mechanical design, software development and product engineering. It is hard to say when Ares could be available for release without his optimization. He is the one who first thought of applying Raspberry-Pi to Ares.


 Acknowledgement

Firstly we would like to thank the firmware made by Marlin, as well as many other open source projects by Octopi, Cura and Freelss and the persons who share their design on Thingvierse. It is the spirit of open source that pushes 3D printing forward a great deal, and that brings more people into the world of 3D. Consistent with such spirit, our design documents and relative software will be open source on delivery.

Then the special thanks will be given to the business incubator of Wuhan ITRI of Geo-Resources and Environment Co., Ltd.

And we really thank the creators for their fantastic 3D models:
MBCook Squirrel with Lego hand grip by cfg, Bear by ashih1, ZYYX vase by ZYYX3DPrinter, Sappho's Head by LukeChilson, Kickboxing by Complimesh, Parametric Lego Fence Door by projunk, Swedish Farm House by Cleven, are all licensed under the Creative Commons - Attribution - Share Alike license.Pen Holder by damm301, Anais by fantasygraph, are licensed under the Creative Commons - Attribution license.


 Risks and challenges

1. Supply chain and logistics
No one wants to see a good idea being executed poorly. We have worked extremely hard to prepare mass production for Ares, but we still face several challenges. Currently, many suppliers have been secured for the components. The remaining issue is to set up warehouses for the production line. That's why we are constantly working with specialists of supply chain to establish a production line of high efficiency and reliability. The challenge is obvious as we must make sure the delivery of this amazing can be arranged as soon as possible. Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.
2. Shipping
Shipping costs vary with your country and specific location. To reduce the cost of Ares at the maximum, we decide to charge the shipping costs separately, also for the sake of fairness. After the campaign, we will send you a survey by email to collect your basic contact details like name, address for delivery. Of course you can decide your own option for shipping. However, shipping is another risk which might be out of our control during delivery. So it is recommended that we choose the best shipping option for you, based on your location. According to your option, we will charge extra with the exact costs for shipping. We will arrange the shipment only after your payment has been confirmed. If you want to know how much it will cost, please contact us at easyarts@126.com.


 Frequently asked questions

Please read the FAQs below carefully before claim. If you cannot find what you are satisfied with or interested in, don't hesitate to contact us at easyarts@126.com.

Q1: Why it shows free shipping when I claim the perk, while actually shipping not included?

EasyArts: Okay, good question. We do apologize for this conflict. As you know, shipping fee for worldwide is various, so we cannot determine how much the shipping will cost. Indiegogo does NOT support various settings for shipping, so the default fee has to be $0, thus resulting in "free shipping". Shipping is NOT included for "Assembled ARES 3D Printer". Please refer to the "Risks and challenges" section for more details about shipping.

Q2:Why the price of three optional modules is different from each other?

EasyArts: Really good point. Many people may be wondering what is the price difference of our three optional modules, which is the same during previous campaign. Actually, if you read the description of these perks, you may realize some difference, that is, "Shipping HAS BEEN included". So that is the source of price difference. In other words, CNC costs most while Laser costs least in terms of shipping. We believe this will bring you and us greater convenience, as both of us can just care about the shipping fee of ARES. To put it another way, you won't worry how much it will cost for optional modules, which has been included.
Q3: How can you know which module(s) I have claimed without any comments?
EasyArts: Good question. Of course you can inform us at easyarts@126.com about your desired module(s) if you like. Actually, after this campaign, we will contact all of the supporters (contribute $399 or more) to confirm your module(s), no matter you have informed us or not. So don't worry about your module(s). If we still haven't got your confirmation before shipment, you will receive sequential module(s) (LASER ENGRAVING -> 3D SCANNING -> CNC ENGRAVING), so that you won't get same module(s) for a perk.

Q4: What if there is no available WiFi access? Can this printer work off-line?

EasyArts: WiFi or Internet access is our featured function for Ares in view of convenience, but NOT required. So you can still use the printer as long as you have a computer. Just connect your PC and 3D printer by the data cable we provide (2 meters long), your Ares will be able to work.
Q5: Do I have to install a specific software or app to control the printer?
EasyArts: No, the control system of Ares has already been installed inside the printer. And we offer a much more convenient option for Ares, that is, telnetting into the printer through browser. Please refer to the user's manual for the specific operation. In this way, you can gain control of Ares provided that you have a browser, no matter what kind of OS you use, for instance, Windows, Mac Os, Linux and Android.
Q6: Do I have to prepare specific formatted files for laser engraving or CNC milling function?
EasyArts: No special files are required for the laser engraving or CNC milling function. A self-developed software can help you deal with JPG/BMP files. We are glad to inform you that the software will be FREE if you claim ANY ONE of the perk except "Friendly Sponsorship".
Q7: Is it necessary to calibrate the platform before printing?
EasyArts: Normally NOT. Calibration of the platform is required ONLY when the location of your printer has been changed. In addition, the printer supports automatic calibration, which has been built inside, so don't worry about this if you have to calibrate the platform.
Q8: What is the resolution of the scanner? What if I want to scan/reverse colorful objects?
EasyArts: The available resolution is greater than or equal to 0.3 mm. The HD scanner and camera supports colorful mode, so your scanned models will also in similar color. Please refer to the specification section for more parameters of 3D scanning. Thank you.
Q9: What is the consume material for printing? Do I have to buy it from EasyArts?
EasyArts: Currently the main material for 3D printing function is PLA. It is expected that other various materials will be supported through extensions as well in the near future, for example, high-melting-point plastic (carbon fiber, nylon, graphene etc.). PLA is quite common now, we do offer perks for our contributors, but it is not a must to buy it from us. In fact, we will offer some free PLA (1kg) to improve your experience of Ares.
Q10: I am a DIY maker, can I develop my own module(s)?
EasyArts: Of course. Actually, this printer is for designers and DIY makers. The switchable platform is designed for such extensions. So we really encourage you to do this. Just follow the instructions and the standard for your adapter(s) / connector(s), which will be released after this campaign, you will find it quite easy to develop your own module(s). Go ahead for your imagination and creation.
Q11: I am a journalist, can I report the story about your team and your 3D printer?
EasyArts: You are mostly welcomed. Thank you for your willingness to help us popularize EasyArts and Ares. Don't hesitate to contact us at easyarts@126.com.
Q12: Do you need any distributors for this 3D printer? Is there any requirement to be your distributors?
EasyArts: Yes, any distributors interested in our product are warmly welcomed all around the world. We prefer to work together with you to generalize 3D printing technology. As for the requirements, we would like to say totally NO right now, so long as you want to join us. In addition, as our distributors, you will get professional training for the promotion of this printer for FREE. If you have such intention. please contact us at easyarts@126.com.

story:
Hi, 

We are V2V Technology and we are creating a new mobile application that may help save lives. Have you ever known anyone who has been involved in a serious motorcycle collision? We have, and that was the catalyst and light bulb moment when we started looking into motorcycle safety issues in early 2013. The deeper we researched, the more inspired and committed we became to finding a way to fight back the alarming trend of serious injuries and fatalities on our roads involving motorcycles and automobiles.

           


The statistics for 2013 from the GHSA will be out in June 2014 and the upward trend of serious injuries and fatalities is expected to continue. Add on the increasing number of motorized *scooters on the road, which are not accounted for in these reports and you can clearly see where this trend is going.

"We are seeing more people riding scooters in heavy traffic. You couple that with their lack of experience and motorists not sharing the road or seeing the scooter, and it's a recipe for tragedy and death," said Mike Stout, director of traffic safety.


Our young drivers are the key to the future of Motorcycle Safety - already attuned to new technologies

  • Implementing new methodologies of safe driving behavior, inclusive of motorcycle awareness-every time they get behind the wheel

  • Getting them involved from the very start through their first few years behind the wheel will promote safer driving habits for the long term

  • These methodologies together with new technologies like V2V, will create a new generation of responsible young drivers

  • Young drivers will have the largest impact on the future of highway safety for both motorcycle riders and motorists alike

http://federalregister.gov/a/2013-00682, and on FDsys.gov:    

This 200 page document which includes measures to decrease the amount of accidents, and fatalities including and involving motorcycles on our roads, nationwide. (145) (c) includes marketing and educational efforts to enhance motorcyclists awareness.

I have to admit I have not seen any of these measures in place, and few if any of the "marketing and educational efforts". Slogans are merely slogans if they do not affect real changes in the way people think and act. We had to find a way to do more and we have! 

     


Our Vision – Our Mission

Vehicle-to-vehicle communications moved one step closer to reality this week with the Obama administration’s plans to push the technology forward. The February 3rd announcement outlines a set of proposed rules would be announced for comment by the time this administration departs in 2017, with hopes that sometime around 2020, cars will communicate with each other and alert drivers to roadside hazards ahead.

Recent Reports from the CES (Consumer Electronics Show) by several auto manufacturers were clear about the challenges of reaching and excepting a standard for The Automotive Industry as a whole - 2020 or beyond is the consensus. There will also be the financial logistics involved in getting a modular-antenna (wifi-device based) products into the market in a reasonable period of time. The wheels of government turn very slowly.

Last and certainly not least the monetary interest of giant corporations in getting a stronghold and the lion’s share of the market first. Left in the hands of governmental agencies and tied with private corporate interests; in today’s political climate in Washington it seems they have a hard time just getting out of their own way.

Our goal is to take the reins and put this technology in the hands of as many motorists and motorcyclists as quickly and as efficiently as we can. We will offer our V2V technology for just a few dollars to make it affordable to everyone. At the current rate of yearly fatalities, by 2020 we will have lost another 30,000 plus people on our roads involving motorcycle accidents. We find this tragic and unacceptable. We the people, have the power - the commitment and the technology available to make a difference now.  


Research

We began our research focused on  the  pre-existing technology in this field over the past  two decades. The majority were primarily various forms of electronic and radio frequency based devices. They all required some method of mechanical  installation on both the automobile and the motorcycle; all proved to be too costly for both the manufacturers and the public. With our gratitude and all due respect to the people who engineered these products. Their past work gave us a very sound, detailed, and focused basis on which to build our own technology.


V2V Technology 

 V2V is a mobile  application designed to alert the automotive vehicle driver when one or more motorcycles are approaching and/or are in the vicinity of the automobile. The driver of the vehicle will be made aware of one or more approaching motorcycles from any direction and at multiple distances. A motorcycle rider with an active V2V app. will transmit its position, velocity- mph, direction of travel, status, path history, path prediction, and a unique identification code to all automobile drivers who have an active V2V app within a specified range or geofence and  divided into 3-zones known as the "Alert Zones". 

V2V uses (vehicle to vehicle) dedicated, location aware and context aware, enhanced GPS based communications in combination with our proprietary technology AGC advanced geofencing capabilities This technology  provides a 360-degree view of all vehicles equipped with V2V Technology within communication range. Multiple  indicators called Alert zones are  used by V2V Technology to help prevent crashes. They are GPS position, speed-mph, acceleration, direction, status,  path history, and path prediction.

The V2V app in the automobile will receive the information sent out by the motorcycle and calculate if a motorcycle is in a certain specified range called the “Alert  Zones”. If a motorcycle enters the highest alert zone called the “Threat Zone”, the V2V app in the automobile will alert the driver via specific color GPS icons - plus a pulse-tone for immediate threats.

When a  motorcycle enters the "Threat Zone", the V2V app generates a red icon and pulse-tone. As the motorcycle gets closer and is x number of meters away, the red icon indicator will signal a clear threat, allowing the driver time to react accordingly. The automobile driver can then reset the V2V app. After reset, if the same motorcycle is still in the threat zone, the light/pulse indicator will have a dimmed icon and sound will be off. After a specified time, if the same motorcycle is still in threat range, the V2V app will alert the driver once more. V2V will continue to monitor until the motorcycle is out of the Alert  Zones.

V2V has three alert zones: Green, Yellow, and Red. All are based on proximity or distance from the automobile driver. 


The green icon represents a motorcycle identified as a low alert status. If this motorcycle begins to pick up speed and moves closer to the automobiles path, it will then be identified as a yellow or mid alert status. And if necessary, the motorcycle will be identified as a red or high alert status nearing the threat zone.

The zones can be preset  for various distances to suit each individual drivers needs such as, cities with higher traffic volumes to more rural areas where there is less traffic on the roads.

 

  V2V: "Your Extra Eyes On The Road"

   

Over 52% of accidents involving motorcycles and automobiles are right of way violations by automobile drivers. Motorcycles are often moving fast and are hard to see. Disaster can strike in a blink of an eye on our roads.

There are many questions you may be asking yourself as to how  V2V Technology functions. On our website www.V2Vtechnologyteam.com, we have addressed several of these questions in our Technology and Features Pages and our F.A.Q. page. We invite you to visit our website and welcome any questions or feedback from you. 

Before starting out on the creation and programming phase we introduced our concept to a broad audience through our blog. We gathered information from motorists, bike riders, daily commuters, and many more. We wanted their feedback and input. This insightful and  real world information gave us even more insight and focus on the kind of technology we wanted to create. Our goal is to create an very intuitive and simple to use application for both automobile drivers and motorcycle riders. 


From our F.A.Q page

Question: What happens if there is more than one motorcycle in my area, while I'm driving around in my car?

Answer: Each motorcycle rider app will generate its own identification code, position, direction,  and velocity-mph. The V2V app in the car will be able to detect multiple motorcycles at any given time. If there are three motorcycles in the area, V2V will identify, classify, and generate a status icon on all three depending on their proximity and relativity to the automobile’s direction of travel. V2V will continually monitor all three motorcycles and update their status until they are out of alert range.  The automobile driver will receive the alerts and status at the times when the V2V was triggered; one motorcycle at a time or all at once depending on the scenario. In either case, the automobile driver will have the option to simply reset the V2V app with one touch, or let the alerts time out naturally. The key factor is to let the driver be aware that there are one or more motorcycles in the area, so be alert! Driver safety is all about awareness.   

Excellent question, and many others were answered and helped us further our development of V2V technology.


   


Creation - Development - Allocation of Funds

Given the current mobile device market, we want to give our customers a high-quality app on the top three platforms: Android, iOS and Windows Phone. However, designing and building apps across these platforms can lead to a myriad of challenges, among them the need to reconcile the unique native languages of each platform while creating an elegant, intuitive and consistent user experience.

To meet the needs of this complex reality, we chose a development technology that addresses both operational and strategic objectives. Currently, there are three options: build native apps specific to devices, use HTML5 to build web-based apps, or adopt a platform approach.

We also needed to consider the full life cycle of our V2V app, not just the development stage. Planning for long-term governance, data security, and enterprise integration were also key factors in choosing a development methodology.

                  

Appcelarator Titanium is our platform of choice. This platform approach will allow us to serve a full customer base — not just one segment with a specific device. This ensures greater adoption by having a single code base that can be updated when new features, functions, devices, or operating systems are rolled out. The days of one or two devices covering a large majority of users are likely behind us. Instead of fewer devices, we will see more volume, variety, and more complexity. V2V Technology will need to run not only on phones but on newer wearable technologies like glasses and watches to increasingly smarter and more flexible devices. We want to stay ahead of the curve with V2V Technology. Our users will demand the information and capabilities they want, when and where they need it. V2V Technology will provide this for the long term. We want to:

Create an amazing app experience across multiple operating systems and devices from a single code base

  • Mobilize any data source, public or enterprise
  • Test our app faster with improved quality and control
  • Gain end-to-end visibility into test coverage, API usage, user experience, app adoption and performance

Currently we are in the wire frame phase with our developer. Creating the graphics, features, and interface usability focusing on ease-of-use. The next step is live prototyping and fully integrated automated testing; Working closely with our designers and developers. A collaborative and cohesive effort to build V2V Technology as a truly innovative app at mobile speed.

This is where ninety percent of the funds raised will be allocated. The remaining ten percent will be dedicated to: 

  • Brand development
  • Social media marketing
  • Creative services
  • Integrated media services
  • Public relations and public awareness campaigns coordinated with state and national  public traffic safety organizations 

All part of our comprehensive marketing strategy.

(Please see our stretch goals for V2V below)


What You Get:

You get to be a part of a movement, you get to be one of the first to own The V2V app and help spread the word and awareness of a very real and serious issue in our society. And yes you get a really cool perk because we truly appreciate your support and belief in what we are creating.

Perks will ship along with a personal thank you from us within 3 weeks of campaign ending successfully

Full Product Description:

V2V app 1.0 Available with features for both automobile drivers and motorcycles, motorized scooters and just about any form of personal transportation that shares the roads with automobiles.  

Built on Appcelerator Titanium Platform Technology

For: iOS Apple, Android, and Windows 8 phone 


What We Need:

We need $28,000 USD to complete our full app development.

(Please see our Perks below)


Our Vision:
To see less of this on the roads, sooner
                           

 

WITH YOUR GREAT HELP AND SUPPORT:

  • You get to be part of a grass roots movement,  a unified nation wide initiative that can help save lives

  • Statistics are numbers and sometimes we forget  that these statistics on a chart also represent real people like you and me; fathers,  daughters, mothers, sons, friends, and neighbors

  • We can develop  V2V Technology into a  second generation technology with our API Enterprise Integration Component and integrate our technology with other industries  such as auto manufacturers in the near future.

  • The goal is real awareness. Where V2V Technology becomes a household name; an organic  part  of  American Society and Values and  our pride in American  ingenuity

  • We made a very conscientious choice to have V2V Technology designed, developed, and created in the U.S.

  • LIFE IS PRECIOUS. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

 

                      

       Timeline to a Successful Launch For 

                        V2V   1.0

A. Wireframe- Planning & Prototyping – After achieving a  clear vision  of our  V2V app solution. Our developers will produce the required documentation and other tangibles (PRD, prototypes and interactive mockups, development options, including API integrations, client-server architectures, third-party implementations, administrative features), which will serve as a premise for further development, allowing us to prove our concept and envision future scalability of our mobile V2V app 1.0.

B. Deployment & Testing – Armed with pre-development deliverables, V2V Technology developers will set to translating documented requirements into a compelling mobile solution; while our developer's Quality Assurance team will make sure that it performs flawlessly across a variety of target devices with different form factors and provides the same great experience at the myriad of mobile view ports available in the mobile market today.

C. Analysis & Optimization – The third step is to evaluate our mobile app performance, get feedback from our users and spot new opportunities to improve and enhance our mobile solution and set up an interactive optimization process to engage our users and nurture their loyalty and trust with improved sets of new functionality, features,  and updates,  rolled out on a steady basis.

D. Completion & Rollout – With our V2V app ready to go live. Our developers will secure their efforts by deploying it into our IT infrastructure and assisting V2V Technology with its release of V2V app 1.0 to app stores, so that we can begin the initiative to make our roads safer.


Perks




V2V Future Technology Development – Stretch Goals

Mobile Device Screen Casting -- Contact Analogue Display Technology

Here at V2V Technology Team we have been very careful not to put the cart ahead of the horse with our technology development. Our main objectives are to deliver a high quality app within our designated timeline and ensure long-term governance, data security, and enterprise integration options moving forward in order to provide timely, fully functional updates of V2V to our user base.  The data demands of V2V Technology will continue to increase and keeping pace with growth and advancing technologies through the life cycle of our V2V is paramount.

       

We are excited about the possibilities of integrating visual enhancement technologies with V2V. We have opened channels of communication with other evolving technology developers in the areas of mobile device screen casting. Translation: Your IOS, Android, or Windows device can project the screen right on to the vehicles windshield. 

Contact Analogue Display Technology - a special form of augmented reality. The displayed information is integrated into the external environment in the correct perspective and at the actual point or points in the scene to which it relates, so that effectively the information appears to be “attached” to the external objects. Contact analogue displays have many advantages. The fact that the information is presented in the driver’s direct line of sight, and that it is overlaid on the objects it is referring to, means that the driver does not have to shift his attention away from the driving scene. His gaze is not distracted and he does not have to change focus, as he does when looking back from an instrument cluster or central information display to the road. This means that information relevant to the driving situation can be scanned more quickly and more directly. At the same time, currently required actions can be displayed in an intuitive form.

Any and all funds above our goal will be entirely allocated and directly focused into continued development into these new emerging technologies to enhance the capabilities, features, and functions of V2V. Our supporters will be kept informed on new V2V Technology developments and through continued app updates moving forward. 


Thank you from your friends at V2V Technology Team.



John Alvarez - Technical Director

Amanda Meinwieser - Project Manager

Michael Cocuzza - Financial Advisor

My Inspiration

My two beautiful kids Madelyn, 12 and Gabriel, 8. When they reach the age to legally drive, my hopes are that vehicle to vehicle driving safety technology will be a standard in all vehicles in the US. To show them that indeed anything in our lifetime is possible. This great country was built on American ingenuity and innovation and with determination and unwavering perseverance, any dream can become a reality. To make a long lasting contribution to the future safety of the 9 million plus motorcyclists on our roads.
story_txt:
Hi, 
We are V2V Technology and we are creating a new mobile application that may help save lives. Have you ever known
anyone who has been involved in a serious motorcycle collision? We have, and that was the catalyst and
light bulb moment when we started looking into motorcycle safety issues in
early 2013. The deeper we researched, the more inspired and committed we
became to finding a way to fight back the alarming trend of serious injuries
and fatalities on our roads involving motorcycles and
automobiles.
           The statistics for 2013 from the GHSA will be out in June 2014 and
the upward trend of serious injuries and fatalities is expected to continue. Add on
the increasing number of motorized *scooters on the road, which are not
accounted for in these reports and you can clearly see where this trend is
going.
"We are seeing more
people riding scooters in heavy traffic. You couple that with their lack of
experience and motorists not sharing the road or seeing the scooter, and it's a
recipe for tragedy and death," said Mike Stout, director of traffic safety.

Our young drivers are the key to the
future of Motorcycle Safety - already attuned to new technologies
Implementing
new methodologies of safe driving behavior, inclusive of motorcycle
awareness-every time they get behind the wheel
Getting
them involved from the very start through their first few years behind the
wheel will promote safer driving habits for the long term
These
methodologies together with new technologies like V2V, will create a new
generation of responsible young drivers 
Young
drivers will have the largest impact on the future of highway safety for both motorcycle
riders and motorists alike
http://federalregister.gov/a/2013-00682, and on FDsys.gov:     
This 200
page document which includes measures to decrease the amount of accidents, and
fatalities including and involving motorcycles on our roads, nationwide. (145) (c) includes marketing
and educational efforts to enhance motorcyclists awareness.
I have to admit I have not seen any of these
measures in place, and few if any of the "marketing and educational efforts". Slogans
are merely slogans if they do not affect real changes in the way people think
and act. We had to find a way to do more and we have! 
     Our Vision – Our Mission
Vehicle-to-vehicle
communications moved one step closer to reality this week with the Obama
administration’s plans to push the technology forward. The February 3rd announcement outlines a
set of proposed rules would be announced for comment by the time this
administration departs in 2017, with hopes that sometime around 2020,
cars will communicate with each other and alert drivers to roadside hazards
ahead. 
Recent Reports from the CES (Consumer
Electronics Show) by several auto manufacturers were clear about the
challenges of reaching and excepting a standard for The Automotive Industry as
a whole - 2020 or beyond is the consensus. There will also be the financial logistics involved in getting a
modular-antenna (wifi-device based) products into the market in a reasonable period
of time. The wheels of government turn very slowly.
Last
and certainly not least the monetary interest of giant corporations in getting a
stronghold and the lion’s share of the market first. Left in the hands of governmental agencies
and tied with private corporate interests; in today’s political climate in
Washington it seems they have a hard time just getting out of their own way. 
Our
goal is to take the reins and put this technology in the hands of as many
motorists and motorcyclists as quickly and as efficiently as we can. We
will offer our V2V technology for just a few dollars to make it affordable
to everyone. At the current rate of yearly fatalities, by 2020 we will have
lost another 30,000 plus people on our roads involving motorcycle
accidents. We find this tragic and unacceptable. We
the people, have the power - the commitment and the technology available to make
a difference now.  ResearchWe began our research focused on 
the  pre-existing technology in this field over the past 
two decades. The majority were primarily various forms of electronic
and radio frequency based devices. They all required some method of mechanical  installation on both the automobile and the motorcycle;
all proved to be too costly for both the manufacturers and the
public. With our gratitude and all due respect to the people who
engineered these products. Their past work gave us a very sound, detailed, and
focused basis on which to build our own technology.V2V Technology 
 V2V is a mobile  application designed to
alert the automotive vehicle driver when one or more motorcycles are approaching
and/or are in the vicinity of the automobile. The driver of the
vehicle will be made aware of one or more approaching motorcycles from any direction and at multiple distances.
A motorcycle rider with an active V2V app. will transmit its position, velocity- mph, direction of travel, status, path history, path prediction, and a
unique identification code to all automobile
drivers who have an active V2V app within a specified range or geofence and  divided into 3-zones known as the "Alert Zones". V2V uses (vehicle to vehicle) dedicated, location aware and context aware, enhanced GPS based communications in combination with our proprietary technology AGC advanced geofencing capabilities This technology  provides a 360-degree view of all vehicles equipped with V2V Technology within communication range. Multiple  indicators called Alert zones are  used by V2V Technology to help prevent crashes. They are GPS position, speed-mph, acceleration, direction, status,  path history, and path prediction.The V2V app in the automobile
will receive the information sent out by the motorcycle and calculate
if a motorcycle is in a certain specified range called the “Alert  Zones”. If a motorcycle enters the highest alert zone called the “Threat Zone”, the V2V app in the
automobile will alert the driver via specific color GPS icons - plus a pulse-tone for immediate threats.
When a  motorcycle enters the "Threat Zone", the V2V app generates a red icon and pulse-tone. As the motorcycle gets closer
and is x number of meters away, the red icon indicator will signal a clear threat, allowing the driver time to react accordingly. The
automobile driver can then reset the V2V app. After reset, if the same motorcycle is still in the threat zone, the light/pulse indicator will
have a dimmed icon and sound will be off. After a specified time, if the same
motorcycle is still in threat range, the V2V app will alert the driver once
more. V2V will continue to monitor until the motorcycle is out of the Alert  Zones.
V2V has three alert zones: Green, Yellow, and Red. All are
based on proximity or distance from the automobile driver. The green icon represents a motorcycle identified as a low alert status. If this motorcycle begins to pick up speed and moves closer to the automobiles path, it will then be identified as a yellow or mid alert status. And if necessary, the motorcycle will be identified as a red or high alert status nearing the threat zone.
The zones can be preset  for various distances to suit each individual drivers needs such as, cities with higher traffic volumes to more rural areas where there is less
traffic on the roads.   V2V: "Your Extra Eyes On The Road"   Over

hard to see. Disaster can strike in a blink of an eye on our roads.
