RAM bit errors can get written to disk and ruin your data. That's why we built error-correcting (ECC) RAM into each an every antsle.
Best of all: You don't need to worry about these things. We've built ZFS, mirroring and ECC into our antsleOS. It will be automatically there, in each and every virtual server that you create on your antsle, without you having to care about it in any way. Given our role as the pioneer of home hosting, we thought that's what we owe you.
Here are the details:
 
 
 
 

The antsle is extremely energy efficient. Even at full load of all eight CPU core around the clock, every day, it'll add a mere $2 to your monthly electricity bill. That number is based on a US average of $0.10 / kWh. The Software
 


antsle comes with several layers of software.
First, there is antsleOS. That's our "hypervisor". It's the underlying technology that "slices" your antsle into several, "virtual" servers. So you buy one antsle, and you can then use it to run hundreds of virtual servers, each of which would cost you $20 or so per month with Amazon EC2. We call each of our virtual servers an antlet. Each antlet can either be based on LXC container virtualization for extreme performance, or it can be based KVM hardware-level virtualization in case you want to run an OS other than Linux in your antlet. In a single antsle, you can run Windows in one antlet, SmartOS in another antlet, FreeBSD in a third and a different version of Windows in a fourth antlet.
Then, on top of antsleOS, we have antman™. The word stands for "antlet manager", and it does pretty much what it says: it enables you create and manage your antlets in a super-easy way. If you're familiar with digitalocean: antman works in a very similar way. What do you do with your antlets? If you know how to do it, you can ssh into your antlet and install whatever server-side software you want.
And here's the highlight: Even if you're not familiar with managing a server with ssh and the command line, you can still use your antsle for fascinating things by using our one-click installers.
Here's a screenshot of antman:
 

There are no limits on what you can install in each of your antlets. Examples include:

Host your own home-based email server. That's right, just as Hillary did! ;-)
Manage your contacts and calendars. From your home, rather than with iCloud or google. Access (and change) your antsle-based contacts and appointments from your iPhone, Android, iPad, ...
Have your own "drive" to share files just like Dropbox, but with full data ownership in your home.
Run a basecamp-like team collaboration tool from your home.
Run a CRM system.
Run your own URL shortener, just like bit.ly or t.co, but under YOUR control, and with much shorter URL because you're not sharing URLs with millions of people.
Run gitlab and host 10,000 or so git repositories which would cost you a fortune with github.
Much, much more.

Just one app, that you can easily install in one of your antlets with our one-click installer, is OX App Suite. That apps lets you handle your email, contacts, calendar and Drive on your antsle. It's a piece of freedom - everything's under your own control. We've included a few screenshots of OX App Suite, which is open source software by Open Xchange: Email
 
 
 Contacts
 
 Calendar
 
 Drive
 
  
Slash Your Cost by 90%
 
Most fees for hosting, cloud services etc. are paid on a monthly basis. They sound low. Compare that to antsle: The only thing you pay for is the hardware. You can easily use it for two or even four years.
Over that period, the monthly fees you used to pay before you owned the antsle are really adding up.
We’ve prepared some sample calculations to illustrate that effect.
Of course, every person is different. We’ve created two fictitious individuals, Harry and Sally. Harry is someone that works in a technology environment, and uses hosting services for side projects or on a semi-professional basis. He can’t afford to lose files when someone who he shares a Dropbox folder with accidentally deletes something. So he uses DropBox Pro and Dropbox extended history for himself and someone he works with on a regular basis, such as a VPA or his spouse. He pays github to host a few (private) repositories.
See how the cost breaks down in this table:
 


 
With antsle, in contrast, he pays only for the antsle itself. Everything else is either included or available for a free open-source download. So his new cost structure looks simple:



 
 
Here’s the before/after comparison:

 
 
Quite impressive, huh?
Our next fictitious user is Sally. She is a freelance developer, and collaborates with three other people on a regular basis . She has several clients. See her cost breakdown here:

 
 
And again, the new cost structure with an antsle. In contrast to Harry, Sally is using and antsle Pro, as well as a RAM Upgrade and an HDD add-on.

 
 
Here’s the before/after comparison for Sally:


So with antsle, you’re not only reclaiming 100% data ownership, freedom and autonomy. You’re not only getting a beautiful and 100% silent device. You’re also saving an enormous amount of money!
 
Where we are today:

antsle is already functional today. We have developed, tried and tested our hardware to ensure bare-metal performance with zero noise. The software prototype is also working smoothly but our vision is much bigger than what we are able to accomplish alone. That is exactly what the proceeds of our IndieGoGo campaign will be for:


Your contributions will directly go towards the development of the software that makes the platform great
With your antsle purchase through our campaign, you will receive your very own antsle with free life-time software updates
AND you are directly contributing to the product you will be using for years to come

We need the $15,000 funding goal in order to purchase the minimum order volume of the antsle aluminum cases from our supplier.
This will be an open campaign so your contributions will directly feed into further development of the platform, no matter how much we raise. We have already seen considerable interest from outside investors but part of what we are trying to create is an independent platform with only YOU in control. We've been working on antsle since August 2015 full-time and will continue to do so.
 
Risks & Challenges

 

antman, including a set of six one-click installers, is in a "working prototype" stage. Until delivery of the antsle, we will finish development of antman. This imposes the standard software development risks.
antsle relies on a core team of three. Should one of them cease to work on the team, it can have negative impacts on antsle's time line.

 
 
The Team

Bernd 'Bernie' Blume
 
 

Bernie is CEO and Founder of antsle. He started his career at IBM and later ran his own venture-backed company “Xionet”. After that, he has been working in various interim management positions. He moved to the US in 2014 to further pursue his idea to create the home hosting movement. At antsle, Bernie leads the company strategy and oversees all day-to-day operations.
 

 
 

Kurt Neumann

 
 
 
Kurt Neumann is a seasoned cyber security professional. In the course of his career, he has worked for large enterprises such as Intuit, Time Warner and Cisco. Kurt also co-founded PacketSled, a successful and venture-backed security company. At antsle, Kurt is responsible for the technology and cyber security behind both software and hardware.
 
Ask Us Anything!Whatever question you might have, ask us!
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please make sure you like and follow us, so as many people as possible can find us:
Facebook
Twitter
LinkedIn

story:
We believe that enclosing full-fledged gaming PC inside the form factor of console is the future of gaming, so we spent over two years iterating and perfecting designs through multiple prototypes, to finally bring Sentry to life.


Sentry is the world's first truly console-sized gaming PC chassis. It houses powerful components within a volume below 7 litres, which over the decades has been considered the optimal size for all media appliances residing in front of a TV (gaming consoles, satellite receivers, audio equipment)

 
Device Volume CPU CPU perf. GPU GPU perf. PSU
Big Tower 70L Socket Best Full Size Best ATX
Midi Tower 36L Socket Best Full Size Best ATX
ITX Shoebox 20L Socket Best Full Size Best ATX
ITX Desktop 12L Socket Best Full Size Best SFX-L
ITX Cube 10L Socket Best Single Slot Average SFX
Sentry 7L Socket Best Full Size Best SFX-L
Console 7L Embedded Average Embedded Average External
ITX Micro 6L Socket Average Low Profile Average Flex/TFX
Proprietary 5L Mobile Average Mobile Average External
ITX Thin 3L Socket Average Embedded Poor External
Intel NUC 1L Embedded Average Embedded Poor External


Sentry’s internal design enables fitting powerful mid-range and high-end class pc components into a compact, console-like small form factor.


Sentry combines optimal size with performance while maintaining high customizability thanks to its design, which targets ATX and PCI Express standard compliant off-the-shelf components, that you can order from your local computer store.





"This case is an investment that will easily outlive few generations of CPUs and GPUs"



 



"Truly a console sized PC chassis,
that punches WAY above its size class"



 



"Sentry achieves its purpose perfectly to be a console-sized ITX case with unique character and fine cooling"



 



These and other beautiful photos of Sentry in home environment on this page are courtesy of Zbigniew Mroczkowski, the owner of YetAnotherTechChannel




 
Core Features   
 
 

6.96L Main Body
305mm Graphics Card
SFX-L Power Supply


47mm Cooler Support

2.5" Drives Support

Toolless Vertical Stand


 
Console Form Factor   
 


Sentry is the first truly console-sized PC chassis...
to the point where you cannot differentiate its size from a console.

 



 
Size Matters   
 



Console size is not just an aesthetic extravagance...
it lets you place the computer where you want it to be, not where it fits.

 



 
Mobility   
 


Small size lets you pack your gaming setup
in many 17" laptop bags or backpacks.

 



 
Headset Hanger   
 



When mounted vertically, this super-slim tower becomes a headset hanger.

 






MAIN BODY DIMENSIONS   340 x 310 x 66mm, 6.96L Volume
 
MOTHERBOARD FORMAT   Mini-ITX
 
POWER SUPPLY SUPPORT   SFX, SFX-L (Obstructs second 2.5" mount)
Custom internal pass-through power cord with flexible C13 plug enabling support for multiple power connector orientations
 
GRAPHICS CARD FORMAT   Dual-Slot, Full-Length 12"/305mm
Reference-Sized PCB/Max 18mm oversize
 
STORAGE DRIVE MOUNTS   2x 2.5"x9.5mm drive mounts on central rail
3x 2.5"x9.5mm mounts in graphics chamber
1x Set of Quad 2.5"x12mm drive brackets for use with 200mm max long ITX-sized graphics
 
CPU COOLER FORMAT   Max 47mm tall, may obstruct first 2.5" mount depending on motherboard layout
Max 37mm tall, regardless of motherboard layout
 
MEMORY COMPATIBILITY   Standard profile DIMM modules
max 31.4mm tall pcb/34mm with heatspreaders
Tall modules will obstruct hard drive bracket
 
FRONT PANEL   2x USB 3.0 type A Connectors
16mm anti-vandal momentary power switch with 5v red ring power status LED
 
PCI-E RISER   PCI-E 3.0 x16 support
50mm long flexible ribbon
High quality ribbon shielding
Reinforced PCBxRibbon weld points
 
CASE BODY MATERIAL   1mm thick galvanized steel
high-graininess structural powder coating
 
WARRANTY   one year warranty for chassis body & cables
 
HORIZONTAL ORIENTATION   4x 20mm wide 6.5mm tall chassis feet
Case cover inlet creating air pocket inside graphics card chamber for safe cover temperature and improved thermal performance
 
VERTICAL ORIENTATION   2mm thick galvanized and powder coated vertical stand with rubber contact areas
Toolless mounting with two sliding bolts.
4x 8mm hole plugs in place of chassis feet
 
WIRELESS SUPPORT   3x RP-SMA compatible holes for antennas
 
CASE BODY WEIGHT   6.4lb/2.9kg
 
ACCESSORIES WEIGHT   1.3lb/0.6kg
 


Design of Sentry started within the group of enthusiasts gathered at HardForum's Small Form Factor Systems section.



Project's scope was defined, revised and refined thanks to those enthusiasts who spent their time discussing concepts and designs over the project's life.

Sentry would not become what it is today without their contributions to the project from its early days.



To create the smallest possible case supporting powerful components the standard frame-based approach to PC chassis building had to be abandoned. A number of creative ideas were required to make Sentry what it is today.



 
Straight-in GPU installation   
 


Sentry's design lets user put the graphics card directly into the PCI-E slot and does not waste any space for graphics card maneuvering inside the case.

 



Detachable bracket and case cover combined let the case maintain full structural integrity, becoming a self-supported body, which is the same concept that is used in modern car design.

 



 
Solid Riser Grip   
 


 

Sentry uses its own elegant solution that keeps PCI-E riser tightly in place by its plastic body without straining its weld-points. Riser is installed by sliding it into a gap in central wall with two screws tightening this gap's grasp on riser.



 
Air Pocket over GPU   
 


 

The case cover is equipped with a special insertion that creates small air pocket and partitions the space above graphics card, which limits recirculation of hot air in graphics card chamber, effectively increasing thermal performance.



 
Minimalistic PSU Mount   
 


 

Sentry keeps the power supply in place with 3 screws and a grasp of the front wall. This minimalistic mount design lets the user maneuver freely while installing the motherboard before power supply is installed.
 


 

The distance from the side wall and flexibility of Sentry's internal power cord's connector are calculated to support multiple configurations of power connector's location and rotation on the power supply's wall.



 
Multiple Configurations   
 



Finally, to adapt to various use scenarios, Sentry provides multiple 2.5" mounting points that are availiable depending on components that may or may not require to use additional space. Sentry's product page has a visual tool that lets the user test the possible hardware configurations.




 
Extensively Prototyped   
 
 

Design and prototyping stage of the project took over two years to ensure that case body can be manufactured in target quantity.

Over that time we have completed six functional prototypes while also improving case hardware support, external design, ease of use and performance.




 
Optimized Design   
 



During case development numerous simulations were run to optimize vent layout for the best possible airflow and thermal performance.

 





 
Supreme Matte Finish   
 



We have tested multiple paint types looking for an optimal surface finish, to finally decide on high-graininess structural powder coating, which gives the surface a quality look and feel.

 





 
Production Tested   
 



A few small production batches were made to test fitting repeatability, pinpoint possible manufacturing errors and update designs to improve overall production quality.

 





 
100 Units Funding Goal   
 
 

Sentry's body is designed to be manufactured without mass production tooling, which means it can be manufactured in really small quantities.

 

A minimum of 100 units is a quantity required to get wholesale prices for the components that are also included, such as PCI-E riser, power switch etc.

 

Considering all the interest in Sentry, the 100 units target of this campaign is just a small fraction of interested enthusiasts around the world, which means there is virtually no chance that this campaign will fall short of its target.



 
Made in Poland   
 
 

Sentry was designed and will be manufactured and assembled in Poland. This way we can control the manufacturing process in order to maintain required quality according to specification.
 



 
Help us Deliver Faster   
 
 

We need your help in this campaign because preparing a big batch at once lets us optimize production and deliver Sentry to you and other enthusiasts faster than running sales through multiple worldwide retailers with small initial stock.

 

All perks will be delivered in form Sentry revision 1.1 units which have all the improvements made from feedback we received after shipping revision 1.0 samples for review.



 
Spread the Word   
 
 

Tell your friends about us - help us reach other interested enthusiasts and bring Sentry closer to mass production.
 







 
Chassis Body   
 


 

Inside the package you will find Sentry revision 1.1 body consisting of:

  • Chassis base: bottom element with all the mounting points for hardware
  • Graphics card side wall: detachable element reinforcing case structural integrity
  • Chassis cover: top element of the case with shaped insert over the graphics card
  • Sentry nameplate: laser engraved nameplate with unit number of your Sentry


 
Essential Accessories   
 


 

You will also get all essential accessories required to build a PC inside Sentry:

  • PCI-Express x16 riser: high-quality shielded ribbon with secured weld points
  • Internal power cord: custom made IEC14-IEC13 cable with flexible IEC13 plug
  • Front panel USB3.0: internal USB3.0 20pin plug to external 2-port baffle cable
  • Power switch: standard 16mm anti-vandal momentary switch with red ring LED
  • Chassis feet: 20mm round, 6.5mm tall feet for horizontal chassis installation
  • Vertical stand: toolless vertical stand for the chassis with four rubber feet
  • 8mm hole plugs: plugs for closing the feet mounting holes when using a stand
  • PCI slot covers: two black vented PCI slot covers for use without graphics card
  • External screws: aesthetic black M3 allen magnetic screws for external use
  • Internal screws: standard silver M3 phillips magnetic screws for internal use
  • Quad-drive brackets: 4 x 2.5" drive brackets for installation with 200mm card


 
Sentry 1.1   
 

Sentry 1.1 changes from version 1.0 that was delivered for reviews:

  • Added screws for work with magnetic screwdrivers (all screws)
  • Optimized number and types of screws
  • Vertical stand toolless mounting without sliding it (only screws slide)
  • Higher quality of rubber feet for vertical stand
  • 8 welding-points for top-covers insertion (instead of 6-points in version 1.0)
  • Improved detachable GPU bracket
  • Improved middle hdd/ssd holder
  • One welding point at the back of the case changed to one steel rivet
  • Improved cover's screw mounting points for easier fitting screws in holes
  • Improved online manual
  • Added paper quick manual

There are also many other improvements, which we will not mention here, because those are mostly made for optimization of production, and you, as final SENTRY owners, will not see the difference.





 
Expected Sentry Production Scheme   
 



When Single Black units of the First Batch are no longer available, do not worry. Long Run will launch directly after we ship all First Batch units!

 




Founded in 1996, DR ZĄBER is a small team of world-class specialists solving hard mechanical engineering problems for businesses all around the world.
 


Our portfolio gathered over 20 years of company existence includes projects such as technical towers for telecommunication and measurements, automatization and modernization of heavy duty machines, specialized production lines, customized tools and many more.

 



Apart from services for heavy industry, company specializes in implementation of renewable energy power plants such as wind turbines and small hydro power.

 







 
Our Promise   
 
 

As with all products being produced for the first time we know that unforeseen scenarios can occur. Should this happen we promise our backers that we will do everything and work hard to deliver on spec and as quickly as possible.



 
Tailored for Specific Hardware   
 
 

Sentry is a different kind of product than most of the one-size-fit-all PC cases.

We have delivered information about Sentry throughout multiple media such as youtube reviews, forums, our website with special configuration tool, pdf manual and FAQs, to let you make well informed decision about our product.

We are not responsible for the lack of graphics card measurement standarization in their specs across multiple vendors and generations, nor any other misleading specifications of PC hardware being sold on the market.

If you are not sure whether your hardware fits - STOP - read the FAQ below, ask on the forums or contact us directly through e-mail before ordering Sentry.





 
Perks and Shipping   
 
 

My country is not on the list. Can I get Sentry in some other way?

We have limited campaign perks to the countries where we can ship affordable insured packages. We do not want to force expensive shipping costs on clients from other regions.

Please contact us during campaign, so we can handle your case separately.
 



 
Hardware Configuration   
 
 

Do you have some example hardware configurations?

Yes, please check these proposed builds:

  • $750  -  i3-6100 / 1050 TI 4GB / 8GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD
  • $1000 - i5-6600  /  1060 6GB / 16GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD
  • $1300 - i7-6700  /  1070 8GB / 16GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD
  • $1600 - i7-6700K / 1080 8GB / 32GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD
 

 

How do I know if my graphics card will fit inside Sentry?

It will depend on its size. Graphics cards come in many shapes and sizes.

Please see the image below we have prepared to address this issue:



Check this graphics card compatibility spreadsheet for quick reference:

Sentry Compatibility Spreadsheet

If you are still not sure about your card, then place a comment at HardForum or contact us directly through e-mail before placing your order.
 

Will Sentry fit M.2 under the motherboard?

Sentry is designed according to ATX form factor specification, therefore it has to have clearance of at least 6.35mm below the motherboard. M.2 slot is also complying to ATX form factor therefore it also has to fit within those 6.35mm.

Sentry has 7mm of clearance under the motherboard with additional cutout reducing weight making it 8mm at the center of the board. M.2 drive requires around 5.5mm of clearance underneath the motherboard so it will fit.

Note that You will have to install M.2 on the motherboard before mounting the board itself, since there is no dedicated removable access panel for that.
 



 
Water Cooling   
 
 

Does Sentry support Water Cooling?

No, at least not out of the box. One of the main targets of the case was to be mobile and water cooling in transport poses risk of leaking.

It is also unpredictible how airlines would treat bringing such PC onboard in carry-on luggage and putting it inside an checked luggage defeats the purpose.

With that said, we have tested such configurations for interested enthusiasts:

 



If you are still interested in water cooling inside Sentry please come to the forums to get more information about it or contact us directly.






 
Friends and Content Creators   
 
 

Zbigniew Mroczkowski, Adam Skorupa, Adam Robaszyński-Janiec, Leszek Godlewski, Dawid Romanowski, Dominik Lebiedowicz, Paweł Szczyrbak, Michał Kuk, Artur Maksara, Tomasz Dąbrowski, Albert Pałka, Łukasz Łazarecki, Maciej Miąsik, Marcin Rybiński, Leszek Lisowski, Sebastian Boczek, Mateusz Franke, James Gray, Jason Cameron, Yang Ji
 



 
Community   
 
 

Aibophobia, andgo, Andorski, AstroWan, backfeed, Barbarian_PT, Beeeyeee, Canyouseeitnow, ChronoDog, chx, CknSalad, Corruptedfile, Corumno, Curiositie, danger, Dangman, darksable, DG25, dondan, DontPeek, edward78, EdZ, Ej24, elshekar, energizerfellow, esplin2966, FiDDy, geostation, hooplish, iFreilicht, jtd871, LLOYD-AF, Machupo, mapegl, Necere, niksus, NIVO, octagoncow, pendragon1, pheuno, Phuncz, Qinx, qwerkus, rawrr, RosaJ, Screes, Silentbob343, Stevo_, superblockio, TheFragile, timmay, Urulere, USF-Nealio, Vego17, veryrarium, vipz, WiSK, Wizzard, yolostrats, yyv_146.

 Finally, to adapt to various use scenarios, Sentry provides multiple 2.5" mounting points that are availiable depending on components that may or may not require to use additional space. Sentry's product page has a visual tool that lets the user test the possible hardware configurations.  

Extensively Prototyped 
 



 

 
Design and prototyping stage of the project took over two years to ensure that case body can be manufactured in target quantity.Over that time we have completed six functional prototypes while also improving case hardware support, external design, ease of use and performance.


 

Optimized Design 
 



 






During case development numerous simulations were run to optimize vent layout for the best possible airflow and thermal performance. 
 

Supreme Matte Finish 
 



 


 We have tested multiple paint types looking for an optimal surface finish, to finally decide on high-graininess structural powder coating, which gives the surface a quality look and feel. 
 

Production Tested 
 



 


 A few small production batches were made to test fitting repeatability, pinpoint possible manufacturing errors and update designs to improve overall production quality. 
  

100 Units Funding Goal 
 



 

 Sentry's body is designed to be manufactured without mass production tooling, which means it can be manufactured in really small quantities. A minimum of 100 units is a quantity required to get wholesale prices for the components that are also included, such as PCI-E riser, power switch etc. Considering all the interest in Sentry, the 100 units target of this campaign is just a small fraction of interested enthusiasts around the world, which means there is virtually no chance that this campaign will fall short of its target.
 

Made in Poland 
 



 

 Sentry was designed and will be manufactured and assembled in Poland. This way we can control the manufacturing process in order to maintain required quality according to specification. 
 

Help us Deliver Faster 
 



 

 We need your help in this campaign because preparing a big batch at once lets us optimize production and deliver Sentry to you and other enthusiasts faster than running sales through multiple worldwide retailers with small initial stock. All perks will be delivered in form Sentry revision 1.1 units which have all the improvements made from feedback we received after shipping revision 1.0 samples for review.
 

Spread the Word 
 



 

 Tell your friends about us - help us reach other interested enthusiasts and bring Sentry closer to mass production. 



  

Chassis Body 
 



 


  Inside the package you will find Sentry revision 1.1 body consisting of:


Chassis base: bottom element with all the mounting points for hardware

Graphics card side wall: detachable element reinforcing case structural integrity

Chassis cover: top element of the case with shaped insert over the graphics card

Sentry nameplate: laser engraved nameplate with unit number of your Sentry

 

Essential Accessories 
 



 


  You will also get all essential accessories required to build a PC inside Sentry:


PCI-Express x16 riser: high-quality shielded ribbon with secured weld points

Internal power cord: custom made IEC14-IEC13 cable with flexible IEC13 plug

Front panel USB3.0: internal USB3.0 20pin plug to external 2-port baffle cable

Power switch: standard 16mm anti-vandal momentary switch with red ring LED

Chassis feet: 20mm round, 6.5mm tall feet for horizontal chassis installation

Vertical stand: toolless vertical stand for the chassis with four rubber feet

8mm hole plugs: plugs for closing the feet mounting holes when using a stand

PCI slot covers: two black vented PCI slot covers for use without graphics card

External screws: aesthetic black M3 allen magnetic screws for external use

Internal screws: standard silver M3 phillips magnetic screws for internal use

Quad-drive brackets: 4 x 2.5" drive brackets for installation with 200mm card

 

Sentry 1.1 
 



 


Sentry 1.1 changes from version 1.0 that was delivered for reviews:

Added screws for work with magnetic screwdrivers (all screws)
Optimized number and types of screws
Vertical stand toolless mounting without sliding it (only screws slide)
Higher quality of rubber feet for vertical stand
8 welding-points for top-covers insertion (instead of 6-points in version 1.0)
Improved detachable GPU bracket
Improved middle hdd/ssd holder
One welding point at the back of the case changed to one steel rivet
Improved cover's screw mounting points for easier fitting screws in holes
Improved online manual
Added paper quick manual

There are also many other improvements, which we will not mention here, because those are mostly made for optimization of production, and you, as final SENTRY owners, will not see the difference.
   

Expected Sentry Production Scheme 
 



 


When Single Black units of the First Batch are no longer available, do not worry. Long Run will launch directly after we ship all First Batch units!         


Founded in 1996, DR ZĄBER is a small team of world-class specialists solving hard mechanical engineering problems for businesses all around the world.

 Our portfolio gathered over 20 years of company existence includes projects such as technical towers for telecommunication and measurements, automatization and modernization of heavy duty machines, specialized production lines, customized tools and many more.  Apart from services for heavy industry, company specializes in implementation of renewable energy power plants such as wind turbines and small hydro power.      

Our Promise 
 



 

 As with all products being produced for the first time we know that unforeseen scenarios can occur. Should this happen we promise our backers that we will do everything and work hard to deliver on spec and as quickly as possible.
 

Tailored for Specific Hardware 
 



 

 Sentry is a different kind of product than most of the one-size-fit-all PC cases.We have delivered information about Sentry throughout multiple media such as youtube reviews, forums, our website with special configuration tool, pdf manual and FAQs, to let you make well informed decision about our product.We are not responsible for the lack of graphics card measurement standarization in their specs across multiple vendors and generations, nor any other misleading specifications of PC hardware being sold on the market.If you are not sure whether your hardware fits - STOP - read the FAQ below, ask on the forums or contact us directly through e-mail before ordering Sentry.
  

Perks and Shipping 
 



 

 My country is not on the list. Can I get Sentry in some other way?We have limited campaign perks to the countries where we can ship affordable insured packages. We do not want to force expensive shipping costs on clients from other regions.Please contact us during campaign, so we can handle your case separately.   

Hardware Configuration 
 



 

 Do you have some example hardware configurations?Yes, please check these proposed builds:

$750  -  i3-6100 / 1050 TI 4GB / 8GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD 
$1000 - i5-6600  /  1060 6GB / 16GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD 
$1300 - i7-6700  /  1070 8GB / 16GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD 
$1600 - i7-6700K / 1080 8GB / 32GB DDR4 / 275GB SSD + 1TB HDD 
  
How do I know if my graphics card will fit inside Sentry?It will depend on its size. Graphics cards come in many shapes and sizes.Please see the image below we have prepared to address this issue: Check this graphics card compatibility spreadsheet for quick reference:Sentry Compatibility Spreadsheet If you are still not sure about your card, then place a comment at HardForum or contact us directly through e-mail before placing your order. 
Will Sentry fit M.2 under the motherboard?Sentry is designed according to ATX form factor specification, therefore it has to have clearance of at least 6.35mm below the motherboard. M.2 slot is also complying to ATX form factor therefore it also has to fit within those 6.35mm.Sentry has 7mm of clearance under the motherboard with additional cutout reducing weight making it 8mm at the center of the board. M.2 drive requires around 5.5mm of clearance underneath the motherboard so it will fit.Note that You will have to install M.2 on the motherboard before mounting the board itself, since there is no dedicated removable access panel for that. 
 

Water Cooling 
 



 

 Does Sentry support Water Cooling?No, at least not out of the box. One of the main targets of the case was to be mobile and water cooling in transport poses risk of leaking.It is also unpredictible how airlines would treat bringing such PC onboard in carry-on luggage and putting it inside an checked luggage defeats the purpose.With that said, we have tested such configurations for interested enthusiasts: 










If you are still interested in water cooling inside Sentry please come to the forums to get more information about it or contact us directly.    

Friends and Content Creators 
 



 

 Zbigniew Mroczkowski, Adam Skorupa, Adam Robaszyński-Janiec, Leszek Godlewski, Dawid Romanowski, Dominik Lebiedowicz, Paweł Szczyrbak, Michał Kuk, Artur Maksara, Tomasz Dąbrowski, Albert Pałka, Łukasz Łazarecki, Maciej Miąsik, Marcin Rybiński, Leszek Lisowski, Sebastian Boczek, Mateusz Franke, James Gray, Jason Cameron, Yang Ji   

Community 
 



 

 Aibophobia, andgo, Andorski, AstroWan, backfeed, Barbarian_PT, Beeeyeee, Canyouseeitnow, ChronoDog, chx, CknSalad, Corruptedfile, Corumno, Curiositie, danger, Dangman, darksable, DG25, dondan, DontPeek, edward78, EdZ, Ej24, elshekar, energizerfellow, esplin2966, FiDDy, geostation, hooplish, iFreilicht, jtd871, LLOYD-AF, Machupo, mapegl, Necere, niksus, NIVO, octagoncow, pendragon1, pheuno, Phuncz, Qinx, qwerkus, rawrr, RosaJ, Screes, Silentbob343, Stevo_, superblockio, TheFragile, timmay, Urulere, USF-Nealio, Vego17, veryrarium, vipz, WiSK, Wizzard, yolostrats, yyv_146.

story:
Four Seasons comes with:

Vernal White (Spring)

Aestival Blue (Summer)

Autumnal Grey (Autumn)

Hibernal Black (Winter)

 

 

Keycap ‘1’ has been repositioned to the upper left corner above ‘Q’ which fits typing finger habits.

Optimized the sideboard which further extends the lifetime of Four Seasons.

Large keycaps and the improved ‘backspace’ key facilitate and turbo your daily typing and blind tying.

The mechanical switches of ‘enter’ and ‘shift’ have been replaced by a single mount, giving you a more comfy typing experience, and particularly for writers or journalists who type long hours.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Functional Sample of Four Seasons

 

When you combine love and free, you get Lofree. We all come from a designer's background - as reflected in our product. We dedicate ourselves to keep the most sophisticated product simple and elegant, in order to benefit and reach more people. We push boundaries in product design and have won several Red Dot and iF design awards. We love the way of life. This is Lofree. Since the day of the 1st Lofree keyboard has been developed, our life has never been the same. In the crowdfunding campaign in March 2017, We are grateful for your support and raised over US$ 740,000 through 9000+ orders placed by supporters across 107 countries.

 

 

Do I have to pay VAT and duty? Can you lower the declared value for me as I don’t want to pay tax?

For the declared value, we will try our best to declare the most reasonable value. However, due to the customs policy of different countries, we CANNOT fully control if there is any tax exist and our product price is NOT included tax of your country. Please feel free email to hello@lofree.co if there is any specific question.

 

When will you ship the item?
We will ship the item in March, but the time of delivery depends on local delivery speed and customs clearance, which we cannot fully control. Therefore, we cannot guarantee that you will receive the package in September.

 

Remote area shipping cost.
Shipping cost does NOT include extra costs defined as remote area shipping fees on DHL’s website. Please check here if you think your location may be considered remote: http://raslist.dhl.com/jsp/first.jsp. Use with your city’s postal code only for accurate checking.
If you receive our email about remote area extra shipping cost after the campaign, you may consider changing an address that is not in the remote area.

 

How long does the keyboard last on a single charge?

This highly depends on the backlit settings;

Backlit at 40%, normal use: ~2 weeks

Backlit at 70%, normal use: ~1.5 weeks

Backlit at 100%, normal use: ~1 week

If it's low on battery, the USB port LED indicator will blink rapidly. You can recharge with the supplied micro-USB cable.

 

Will you offer a specific region keycaps layout?

Temporarily we don’t have a plan for this.

 

Will we offer different color keycaps?

Temporarily we don’t have a plan for this.

 

Can you change the key position of “fn” and “control”?

We've poured our heart and soul into the design of the keyboard. This is what makes lofree unique. The position of these keys is same as the Apple keyboard which we think it may fit most of the users.

 

How many devices can Four Seasons pair at once?

In total 3 devices, and quick switch between them with fn+1, fn+2, fn+3(Not f3).

story:
Tragedy Averted

As summer approaches, the odds of a repeat of a harried parent forgetting their most precious cargo increase. Jogmind uses state of the art technology to sense the presence of an occupied car seat and alert a parent via mobile alerts and audio alarms:

  • Uses off the shelf wireless tech and mobile devices for alerts.
  • Built in the USA by experienced engineers.
  • The goal is never again will a parent experience this preventable tragedy.

Our secondary goal is to return manufacture of vital technologies to our own shores. Highly skilled local engineers won't just tinker with tech, they will also train at risk young people in the fundamentals of electronics and failure proof software development skills.

What We Need & What You Get

Jogmind is not just a project to build an interesting widget, we are committed to hiring part-time, young people interested in STEM (Science Technology Engineering Math) and to show them that there is a place for them in America not just China or India

  • The $10k ask goes towards off the shelf parts and W2 living wages
  • The biggest perk of all is potentially saving a very young life
  • The prototype is already 50% complete, all money raised will go towards purchase of required micro-controllers, temperature sensors, test equipment, training, manufacture & support, cloud based infrastructure and the delivery logistics chain
  • An independent auditor will supervise all dispersal of funds

The Impact

The biggest impact we can make is ensure not one more report of a child dying from heat stroke or hypothermia:

  • We want to make Jogmind ubiquitous, like the baby carriage itself.
  • Our team has decades of combined experience in software development in general, and recent experience at firms like Proteus Digital Health implementing BLE based medical technologies.
  • Every thing we do works in the principle trust, but verify.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • We need an independent auditor local to the Bay Area
  • The big five automakers could make tech like this available on new vehicles, write Ford, GM, Nissan, Toyota, and Chrysler and ask politely what are they doing to help fix this problem.
  • Be the parent who doesn't forget, make it a habit to scan your vehicle for the little one you brought with you when you head to work.

story:
Photographers Rights

Hi my name is Pietro Zuco and I’m the programmer behind the iPhone app called Photographers Rights. The app is free and you can download the current version here.

Photographers Rights is an application that helps photographers to have an idea about the laws related with photography in different countries. Every country has different regulations and laws about photography, not only about where it is allowed or prohibited to take pictures, but also about copyright.

The idea to create this app was born back in 2011, in a coffee shop in Akihabara, Japan. I was talking with my friend Steve Nagata about technology and photography. I wanted to create a photography related app and he gave me the idea and inspiration to create an app to help photographers with their legal rights around the world. I’m not a lawyer, so I then contacted a legal advisor, Pepi Valderrama to create the content of this application.

Current App Description

Photographers Rights has 5 sections.

1. Countries

This section covers laws and regulations for: USA, Australia, Canada, UK, Japan, Spain, Italy and France. For example you can find information about what kind of laws apply for taking photos of free passengers in UK or taking a photo to a public place in France.

2. Legal

This section covers general legal content that is compatible internationally with almost all countries. Your rights as a photographer, Copyright and Privacy.

3. Contracts

In this section there are sample contracts, ready to use in English, Spanish, Italian and French. You can print them, send by email or save them in other apps, like Good Reader or Dropbox. 

4. Questions

In this section you can play common phrases pronounced by native speakers. Questions like "May I take you a picture?" or "Ar you a police officer?" Supported languages are French, Japanese, Spanish, Catalan, Italian, German and even an Austrian dialect. You don't have to read them, the iPhone will play them for you using a native speaker voice for each language.

5. Shop

What We Need & What You Get!

I want to improve this app and that costs money and time. That's why I need your help. These are the main improvements:

1. English proof reading of the content.

The application was written by a legal advisor, which is also a language warrior but English wasn't her native language. So we need to improve the grammar and the form of the content of this app.

2. Android version!

A lot of people asked about an Android version. I'm not an Android developer, I'm a photographer and an iOS developer. So I need to hire an Android developer to create a working version of Photographers Rights for Android users as well.

3. iPad version

Many people asked for an iPad version. The current app is only for the iPhone.

4. Increase the languages in the Question section.

A lot of people asked for Russian, Portuguese, Chinese and Cantonese. These new languages will be added but I will try to add more.

* You can be listed in the app as a contributor, only if you wish so :) *

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help.

Share this campaign with your friends, in your social networks, like Facebook, Twitter, Flickr and so forth. Even if you are not a photographer, maybe you have a photographer friend that will be interested in this project.

Use the Indiegogo social buttons at the end of this text to share among your friends.

Thank you for helping in this campaign!!

To keep updated about the changes and improvements of Photographers Rights during the time, also check:

My Blog: http://zuco.org

Twitter: @pietrozuco

Google+ community

Facebook page

* This is a flexible founding. It means that if we reach the goal, I will be able to implement all the promised functionalities. However, if we don't reach the goal, I will only be able to implement some functions, depending on the received amount. For example, maybe I won't be able to pay for the English proof reading, which is quite expensive. In that case,  the perks that include the content of the app in PDF, will be delivered as they are in the current version.  Or maybe I will be able to pay the English proof reading, and sacrifice the Android version.

If we surpass the goal, of course I will do my best to try to implement even more features. 

So please spread the word, so we can reach the goal!! Thanks!! :)

story:
Unfortunately, Hustle wasn't able to continue to operate due to a lack of ongoing funding after the first bulk order and due to technological issues with the product. We would like to thank all of our supporters and apologise that we can no longer keep you fully charged!

Compatible to power the following smartphone brands - and many more:

Do you find your smartphone runs out of battery long before your day is through? Frustrated with having to carry around one of those ugly bulky batteries or a charging cable and sit bound to a wall? Worry no more! We have made running out of power a thing of the past.

AS FEATURED ON:

Hustle has developed the world's smartest bag.

For women, the Hustle Bag is small enough to fit inside your bigger, everyday handbag and big enough to be worn on its own as a clutch or cross body bag.

For men, we have designed a wallet to hold your cards, cash and travel documents - and of course power your phone. When you just need the basics, the middle section pulls out, folds in half and slips into your back pocket like an every day wallet.

A Hustle Bag can power your phone all day and night and even alert you when it's running on empty.

When you get home, simply place your Hustle Bag on the Hustle Charge Pad and be ready to go again in a few hours. It really is that simple. The Hustle Bag will make your life and staying connected easier.


Combining the finest quality leather and materials and a timeless classic design, the team at Hustle have developed a product that all smartphone users need.

Fusing the gap between fashion and cutting-edge technology, Hustle melds style with substance to bring you something you will never leave home without.


No matter what your day brings, and where your night leads you, your Hustle Bag will keep you connected and contactable. Using the latest technology, it has the ability to power your phone up to four times, from 0% to 100%.


Let your smartphone do what its made for. Manage your business and your life - make calls, send emails and texts, Facebook, Instagram, Tweet, Youtube, find directions and search the web - without having to worry about your battery life.

Do all the fun stuff your smartphone can do, while never worrying about missing or making that important call or email again. Now you can do it all and still have a phone full of power to keep you hustling.


A Hustle Bag can power any smartphone by connecting to the ultra thin Hustle Power Pack incorporated into the bag. When your Hustle Bag needs to be recharged, simply place it on the Hustle Charge Pad and the wireless induction charging technology will have it ready to go again in a few hours.


We have combined the latest wireless induction charging technology with the latest in lithium-polymer power to produce the Hustle Power Pack. With 4250mAh of power measuring just 9mm thick and the addition of a smart battery monitor, the Hustle Bag will even alert you when it needs to be recharged, making it not just the world’s smartest purse but powerful too.

The Hustle Charge Pad also incorporates wireless induction charging technology to seamlessly charge your Hustle Bag so it is ready to go when you are. We have developed a USB charging port into the Pad so you can use your existing USB phone cable to charge your phone while your Hustle Bag charges. 


We set out to make our product compatible with all smartphones. We recognise that not everyone has the same phone, or keeps the same phone forever. If you buy a new phone or have more than one phone to power, Hustle will be right there with you.

Compatible to power the following smartphone brands - and many more:

How do we do it? Easy.

Each Hustle Bag is fitted with a micro USB connection plus a snap-on iPhone 4/4S and iPhone 5 connector - so you don’t have to change your Hustle Bag every time you change your phone.


Each Hustle Bag will come in a beautifully presented gift box, with a Hustle Charge Pad and will power any smartphone. Made from the highest quality materials, we will offer two style options for women and one style for men.


Made from the finest leather, the Hustle Bag includes a matching long, detachable cross-body strap. Wear it effortlessly on its own as a bag or a clutch, or simply inside your bigger handbag.


Made from high quality faux leather, the Hustle Clutch will include a matching wristlet strap. Wear it as a clutch, or use it as an insert with your bigger handbag.


Made from the finest leather, the Hustle Wallet is a full size men's wallet. When you feel like travelling lighter, the middle section pops out, folds in half and fits in your back pocket.


Hustle is a small company with big ideas. A husband and wife team who were looking for a solution to an everyday problem. As a mother, a business owner and social media addict, Lisa found the battery life of her smartphone limited the productivity of her day. John’s business and investment experience, entrepreneurial spirit and passion for new technology set the wheels in motion to develop a solution. Having spent every spare minute and too many late nights, nurturing the idea and working on perfecting every aspect of the Hustle Bag, we are finally ready, excited and proud to introduce our "baby" to the world.


We have been working on this for over a year. We have flown round the world and back, met with designers, tech experts, manufacturers, chosen leather, materials and sourced everything we need to make a seamless product. The product has been tested, certified and is ready for large scale production.

We've done the hard yards to find the best suppliers and manufactures. We have narrowed down our partners to ensure we can deliver on quality, time and price.

We have expedited the process by paying the tooling and development costs upfront so we can enter production as soon as possible but we still need to fund:

  • Large component order
  • Bag manufacturing
  • Large scale packaging order


 

Following the end of the campaign (11th of August), backers will be contacted to confirm colour choices and shipping details. If you would like more information on this, please refer to the FAQ section below.


We have subsidised the shipping costs to get your Hustle Bag to you a little bit cheaper. Plus Australian shipping is FREE!

If you live outside of Australia, shipping will be a flat fee of $20 for each Hustle Bag.

You can add the shipping cost to the perk's contribution, or by making a different free contribution. For Corporate Packs, you can multiply the shipping fee with the number of Hustle Bags.

For example, if you live in the US and you selected a Hustle Clutch, the contribution field will display $139. To add $20 for postage, you'll have to manually type in $159. Orders will not be shipped without pre-paid shipping. If you forget, we will send you a friendly reminder before your order is ready to go.

Can the Hustle Charge Pad charge my Qi enabled smartphone?
Yes! The Hustle Charge Pad is compatible with all Qi integrated wireless induction charging devices. For a list of Qi integrated phones click here.

Will it work with my iPhone?
Yes! We developed the Hustle Bag to power iPhone 4/4S, iPhone 5 and pretty much every other smartphone out there.

What smartphones will it charge?
A Hustle Bag will power any smartphone with a micro USB, iPhone4/4s or iPhone 5 connection. 

How long will the battery last?
A Hustle Bag, Clutch or Wallet will power your phone up to 4 times before needing to be recharged. However, every smartphone model has a different battery so this is only a range.

As an example, if you have an iPhone 5, you should get two and half full charges before needing to recharge your Hustle Bag.

How does the wireless charging work?
We have incorporated wireless induction charging technology into the bag so you don’t need to plug it in when you get home. It just makes life that little bit easier. 

How does my phone connect to a Hustle Bag?
We have chosen to incorporate a cable that neatly fits into the bag and easily connects to your phone. Designed by Hustle, we have kept the style, quality and usability consistent with the overall look and feel of the product.

Using a cable allowed us to do two things; 1. make the bag compatible across all smartphones AND 2. it allows you to pick up your phone to check messages and reply to emails without stopping and starting the charging process, which will damage your phone battery.

How will I know when my Hustle Bag is running out of power?
We have incorporated a battery monitor into the Hustle Power Pack that will alert you when the power level drops below 25%. Quite simply, if your Hustle Bag has less than 25% power, it will give you an alert tone when you plug in your phone, similar to the tone when you plug your smartphone in to charge.

How heavy is a Hustle Bag?
The Hustle Bag is very light. The Hustle Power Pack is only 9mm thick, making it one of the thinnest battery packs in the world! All up, it weighs approximately 200g. 

How do I know it is good quality technology?
Our production partners manufacture batteries and electronics for some of the largest household brands. The technology included in the Hustle Bags and Charge Pads should keep your phone going like a “bunny” - if you get what we mean!

All of our products have already undergone rigorous safety and certification testing to ensure they are of the highest standard. 

What is included with each product?
Each Hustle Bag, Clutch or Wallet will come in a beautifully finished Hustle Gift Box, including:

  • Hustle Bag of your choice in dust bag
  • Hustle Charge Pad
  • Power Adaptor - we will try to match the wall adaptor to the delivery country (unless otherwise specified)
  • Micro USB, iPhone 4/4S and iPhone 5 snap-on connectors
  • User Manual 

What happens if we don't reach our funding goal?
If we don't reach our $75,000 funding goal, all pre-order will definitely be delivered! However, not all colours will be available. As we hit certain levels of funding, we will unlock more colours.

What if I love a certain colour but it is still locked? Should I still contribute?
Absolutely! Every contribution helps unlock the next colour. If you contribute we will do our best to ensure you are totally satisfied with your Hustle Bag!

If I chose the FIRST 50 perk, when do I choose my style and colour?
Following the end of the campaign (11th of August), backers will be contacted to confirm styles, colour choices and shipping details.

When do I choose the colour of my Hustle product?
Following the end of the campaign (11th of August), backers will be contacted to confirm colour choices and shipping details.

Am I suppose to manually add shipping if I'm not in Australia?
Yes, you have to add international shipping on top of your selected perk. 

What do I need to do if I forget to pay for shipping?
No problem, just click CONTRIBUTE NOW and put in the actual amount you need to pay. Select "No perk, I just want to contribute." Pay for it and done!

What are the dimensions of the Hustle Bag/Clutch/Wallet?
Bag/Clutch: Height (14cm) x Wide (20cmm)
Wallet: Height (9.5cm) x Wide (21.5cmm) 

How can I update my address?
Please contact us at the email below.

I'd like to buy 2 or more Hustle products, can I pay extra using the same perk?
No, unless you choose the “Corporate Pack” (10x) or more perk options, you would have to make a separate contribution.

Will Hustle have shipping issues with countries like Germany, Italy and the EU?
No. All Hustle products will be sent through world class logistics companies with supporting certification paperwork. i.e. CE, FCC, etc. 

Will I have to pay import tax, duty or VAT?
Contributors will be responsible for any import tax, duty or VAT that arises.

How do I upgrade my perk?
No problem, just click CONTRIBUTE NOW and put in the difference you need to pay to upgrade. Select "No perk, I just want to contribute." Pay for it and email us at the below to inform us of the change.

I would like to buy the accessories too, can I do that in 1 contribution?
Unfortunately, you will have to pay in 2 separate contributions.
story_txt:
Unfortunately, Hustle wasn't able to continue to operate due to a lack of ongoing funding after the first bulk order and due to technological issues with the product. We would like to thank all of our supporters and apologise that we can no longer keep you fully charged!

Compatible to power the following smartphone brands - and many more:




Do you find your smartphone runs out of battery long before your day is through? Frustrated with having to carry around one of those ugly bulky batteries or a charging cable and sit bound to a wall? Worry no more! We have made running out of power a thing of the past.
AS FEATURED ON:





Hustle has developed the world's smartest bag.
For women, the Hustle Bag is small enough to fit inside your bigger, everyday handbag and big enough to be worn on its own as a clutch or cross body bag.

For men, we have designed a wallet to hold your cards, cash and travel documents - and of course power your phone. When you just need the basics, the middle section pulls out, folds in half and slips into your back pocket like an every day wallet.

A Hustle Bag can power your phone all day and night and even alert you when it's running on empty.
When you get home, simply place your Hustle Bag on the Hustle Charge Pad and be ready to go again in a few hours. It really is that simple. The Hustle Bag will make your life and staying connected easier.

Combining the finest quality leather and materials and a timeless classic design, the team at Hustle have developed a product that all smartphone users need.
Fusing the gap between fashion and cutting-edge technology, Hustle melds style with substance to bring you something you will never leave home without.

No matter what your day brings, and where your night leads you, your Hustle Bag will keep you connected and contactable. Using the latest technology, it has the ability to power your phone up to four times, from 0% to 100%.

Let your smartphone do what its made for. Manage your business and your life - make calls, send emails and texts, Facebook, Instagram, Tweet, Youtube, find directions and search the web - without having to worry about your battery life.
Do all the fun stuff your smartphone can do, while never worrying about missing or making that important call or email again. Now you can do it all and still have a phone full of power to keep you hustling.
A Hustle Bag can power any smartphone by connecting to the ultra thin Hustle Power Pack incorporated into the bag. When your Hustle Bag needs to be recharged, simply place it on the Hustle Charge Pad and the wireless induction charging technology will have it ready to go again in a few hours.

We have combined the latest wireless induction charging technology with the latest in lithium-polymer power to produce the Hustle Power Pack. With 4250mAh of power measuring just 9mm thick and the addition of a smart battery monitor, the Hustle Bag will even alert you when it needs to be recharged, making it not just the world’s smartest purse but powerful too.
The Hustle Charge Pad also incorporates wireless induction charging technology to seamlessly charge your Hustle Bag so it is ready to go when you are. We have developed a USB charging port into the Pad so you can use your existing USB phone cable to charge your phone while your Hustle Bag charges. 


We set out to make our product compatible with all smartphones. We recognise that not everyone has the same phone, or keeps the same phone forever. If you buy a new phone or have more than one phone to power, Hustle will be right there with you.
Compatible to power the following smartphone brands - and many more:

story:
The Duoboost Solar case is a multi-function combination of a Powerbank, a protective skin and a solar charger. It extends your iphone 5, 5c and 5s usage time with the convenience of portability. Great for emergencies, outdoor activities or when you simply wish to free yourself from wall charging! Choose from a color range of specially designed skins, that can be used independently. Experience true portable charging now!


Powerbank feature: Duoboost contains a built-in rechargeable Lithium Polymer battery with 2600mAh peak capacity with overcharging and discharge protection circuitry to ensure a prolonged battery life.

Indoor Charging & High Conversion: With the use of large contact area high quality solar panels, solar energy is converted at a high efficiency of 23%. Intelligent IC Control system allows charging even with strong light indoors.

Dual power source: Duoboost comes with the option of conventional wall charging or solar powered charging on-the-go!

Protective Skin Included: Comes with an interchangeable protective snap-on/ snap-off skin, made of drop resistant material TPU material that can be used with the Duoboost Solar Case.

Stylish Skin Color Choice: Skins can be used independently from the Duoboost Solar Case. For iPhone 5C, skin colors available in Black, Blue, Green, Pink and Yellow. For iPhone 5/5S, skin color available in Silver, Gold, Purple and Blue

Portable & Convenient: Duoboost is slim, light and forms a combines to becomes a single object with your iPhone making it convenient to carry around. It’s easy to use, has not extra jacks or fixtures and does not affect the rest of your phone functionalities.

The IDEA

Originally I wanted to find a way to get rid of wall charging completely or to make our iphone completely ‘wall-charge-free’. To a certain extent, the DuoBoost Solar Case has partially achieved that. By also wanting to make it look stylish and great on design, we added a novelty feature by creating these ‘snap-on/snap-off’ skins that you could interchange anytime without interfering in the functions of the phone and can be used in tandem with the case.

Design & Development

After taking into account the current ergonomicity of accessories in the market, Duoboost was based what we was the most commercially popular design. We also had help we from freelance designers (for the case design) and circuit designers (charging circuitry) whose valuable input has directly contributed to the final design and product prototype.

Prototyping

Upon completion of case and circuit design, we went to seek a reliable manufacturer who had relevant industry experience and good quality control processes in place. We currently collaborate with two manufacturers in China, one for tooling, moulding and finishing. The second for building the charging circuitry, assembly and testing. Solar panels and batteries are procured as finished products from other vendors.

Moving forward

At present, prototyping and testing have been successful. Payments have been made for the product mould, design fees, certification and testing services. For initial production, we will need to buy a commercial amount of raw materials and pay the manufacturers to build, assemble and test our product (manufacturing run).

Thank you!

We need your help at Indiegogo. Please take this opportunity to contribute to the next big step. We have some great rewards prepared just for you. Every single dollar counts and every single dollar you donate goes straight into bringing the product to into production and making it a success!

4th week February - Indiegogo campaign begins 

4th Week March - Indiegogo campaign ends 

1st Week April - Ordering of raw materials (factory usage) 

2nd Week April - Consolidation of all donations / Payment for production

3rd week April - Final testing and ship out for verification & inspection. Early backers rewards and expedited shipping backers go out. 

4th week April - The rest of the rewards go 

CHALLENGES / RISKS
We have had a very successful run-up to completing our prototype and we currently do not foresee any major hiccups ahead. Just a few challenges remain as we move into the next stage, initial production.

----Color---- 
We expect there may be minor issues with the color of the snap-on / snap-off skins during production. This is a question of degree and options, rather than a major challenge - there will always be the question of, for example, ‘What kind of blue should be the perfect blue?’ or ‘How shiny should the silver or gold be?’ And so on and so forth...

----Quality Control---- 

Lastly, there is the issue of quality control. Making these products exactly as we want them to be, defect-free and performing exactly to our specifications, will be a long-term challenge. We do work with a factory that has stringent quality control checks and a history of expertise in production and we hope, and will strive to ensure, that our products come out the way we want them to be, all the time, every time.

--- Events Beyond Anyone's Control--- 
Barring any risk of postal or union strikes, changes in legislation, logistics disruptions, production failures or catastrophes of any kind, like say, war, which are real risks in some parts, and any other unanticipated problems on our end that can lead to delays beyond our control, yes, barring all that, we aim to deliver all rewards to our backers on time. Thank you for your help and support! (and for reading up to this point!)
